item.title: Fruit of the Spirit: Patience
item.itunes:subtitle: Good Fruit
item.itunes:author: Javan Shashaty
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Javan Shashaty explains how the Spirit gifts us with patience, how the greater hope of the gospel fuels us forward through any and everything that comes our way, and how the reward of patiently waiting on the Lord's timing is far greater than running hastily into our own desires.
item.description: In this message, Pastor Javan Shashaty explains how the Spirit gifts us with patience, how the greater hope of the gospel fuels us forward through any and everything that comes our way, and how the reward of patiently waiting on the Lord's timing is far greater than running hastily into our own desires.

item.title: Fruit of the Spirit: Kindness and Goodness
item.itunes:subtitle: Good Fruit
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our Fruit of the Spirit study, on this special Independence Day weekend, Pastor Jerry Sander shares about the godly attributes of kindness and goodness. See how the kindness of God begets an overflow of kindness, hope, honor in us, and leads to the salvation of many!
item.description: Continuing our Fruit of the Spirit study, on this special Independence Day weekend, Pastor Jerry Sander shares about the godly attributes of kindness and goodness. See how the kindness of God begets an overflow of kindness, hope, honor in us, and leads to the salvation of many!

item.title: Fruit of the Spirit: Faithfulness
item.itunes:subtitle: Good Fruit
item.itunes:author: Stephan Tchividjian
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our Fruit of the Spirit study, Pastor Stephan Tchividjian shares about the godly attribute of faithfulness. Examining various examples from the different men and women in Scripture, we'll see why we can stand firm and walk in faithfulness to the promises of God.

item.title: Fruit of the Spirit: Gentleness & Self-Control
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our Fruit of the Spirit study, Pastor Chris Baselice shares about the godly attributes of gentleness and self-control and how we can walk in them!

item.itunes:subtitle: Good Fruit
item.itunes:author: Alan Platt
item.itunes:summary: In the final message of our study on the Fruit of the Spirit, Pastor Alan Platt shows us what it means to live in the Spirit and how this impacts our understanding of God, the gospel, worship, community, and life.

item.title: Real Identity
item.itunes:subtitle: The Real Thing
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off this study, Pastor Doug Sauder explores the true identity of the believer.

item.title: Real Wisdom
item.itunes:subtitle: The Real Thing
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Where are you turning to for wisdom? What's your source? How can you distinguish true wisdom from a counterfeit? In this study, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from 1 Corinthians 1:18–2:5 as we discover where true wisdom and understanding come from and how we can embrace it!
item.description: Where are you turning to for wisdom? What's your source? How can you distinguish true wisdom from a counterfeit? In this study, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from 1 Corinthians 1:18–2:5 as we discover where true wisdom and understanding come from and how we can embrace it!

item.title: Real Understanding
item.itunes:subtitle: The Real Thing
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: How can I know the truth about God, His Word, my life, and the world around me? In part three of our study, Pastor Chris Baselice dives into 1 Corinthians 2:6-16 as we discover how God reveals His truth to us, how He gives us understanding, and how this causes us to live differently in the world.
item.description: How can I know the truth about God, His Word, my life, and the world around me? In part three of our study, Pastor Chris Baselice dives into 1 Corinthians 2:6-16 as we discover how God reveals His truth to us, how He gives us understanding, and how this causes us to live differently in the world.

item.title: Real Maturity
item.itunes:subtitle: The Real Thing
item.itunes:author: Stephan Tchividjian
item.itunes:summary: How does a Christian mature? In this message, Pastor Stephan Tchividjian explores 1 Corinthians 3 as we learn how to combat disunity in the church and what real maturity is built upon in light of the truth and wisdom of God.

item.itunes:subtitle: The Real Thing
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder explores 1 Corinthians 4 as we discover what it means to be a good steward of the gospel. We'll also explore the keys to healthy discipleship in our lives.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder takes us through 1 Corinthians 5-6:11 as we discover how to biblically address real problems in the Church in a way that glorifies God and points to Jesus.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary:
NOTE: Due to the mature nature of our conversation, this weekend's message is intended for adult audiences.


In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder will explore 1 Corinthians 6:12-7:40 and explain the purpose and beauty of real intimacy as designed by God.

item.title: Real Sacrifice
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Duane Roberts explores 1 Corinthians 8-9 and shows us how our convictions as believers impact our actions, the biblical limits of our rights and freedoms as believers, and how love is at the center of it all.

item.title: Real Fear
item.itunes:author: David Guzik
item.itunes:summary: In this message, special guest David Guzik shares from 1 Corinthians 10 as we discover the dangers of idolatry and how we can use our freedom in Christ to glorify God, build others up, and amplify the gospel!

item.title: Real Order
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder explores 1 Corinthians 11 as we discover how real order in worship and church glorifies God and leads to peace, flourishing, and freedom for believers!

item.title: Real Purpose
item.itunes:subtitle: The Real Thing
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What's my purpose? How do I discover and live it out? Continuing our study through 1 Corinthians, Pastor Doug Sauder shares from 1 Corinthians 12 as we discover our real purpose! Learn all about spiritual gifts, how we receive them from God, how we use them, and how each and every member of God's family is vital and valued in the work of God to save people.

Learn all about spiritual gifts, how we receive them from God, how we use them, and how each and every member of God's family is vital and valued in the work of God to save people.

item.title: Real Love
item.itunes:subtitle: The Real Thing
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What is love? What does it sound like, look like, or feel like? In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder shares from 1 Corinthians 13 (one of the Bible's most famous chapters) as we discover what real love is. Learn how we experience it, how it changes us, and how we can demonstrate it to others.
item.description: What is love? What does it sound like, look like, or feel like? In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder shares from 1 Corinthians 13 (one of the Bible's most famous chapters) as we discover what real love is. item.title: Real Profit
item.itunes:subtitle: The Real Thing
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Chris Baselice explores 1 Corinthians 14 as we discover the biblical process for exercising gifts in the church, how these gifts benefit the whole church, and why it's important that these gifts be expressed in order and peace and not chaos.
item.description: In this message, Pastor Chris Baselice explores 1 Corinthians 14 as we discover the biblical process for exercising gifts in the church, how these gifts benefit the whole church, and why it's important that these gifts be expressed in order and peace and not chaos.

item.title: An Open Door: Foster Care Weekend
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: On this special Foster Care Weekend, Pastor Doug Sauder explores God's heart for vulnerable children! Hear testimonies, where the Lord is calling us to make an impact, and how you can be part of this amazing work to help open doors for the gospel to work in the lives of kids in crisis!
item.description: On this special Foster Care Weekend, Pastor Doug Sauder explores God's heart for vulnerable children! Hear testimonies, where the Lord is calling us to make an impact, and how you can be part of this amazing work to help open doors for the gospel to work in the lives of kids in crisis!

Hear testimonies, where the Lord is calling us to make an impact, and how you can be part of this amazing work to help open doors for the gospel to work in the lives of kids in crisis!

item.title: Real Victory
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: On this special Mother's Day weekend, Pastor Doug Sauder shares a powerful message from 1 Corinthians 15 as we explore the hope of the gospel in both this life and in eternity, the importance of the resurrection of Jesus as it pertains to our faith, and what this all means for us in the future!
item.description: On this special Mother's Day weekend, Pastor Doug Sauder shares a powerful message from 1 Corinthians 15 as we explore the hope of the gospel in both this life and in eternity, the importance of the resurrection of Jesus as it pertains to our faith, and what this all means for us in the future!

item.title: Real Generosity
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Closing out our study through 1 Corinthians, Pastor Doug Sauder dives into 1 Corinthians 16 as we discover what real generosity looks like! Learn how generosity is a way of life, how it changes lives, brings joy, is contagious, and is rooted in the confidence we have in God!
item.description: Closing out our study through 1 Corinthians, Pastor Doug Sauder dives into 1 Corinthians 16 as we discover what real generosity looks like! Learn how generosity is a way of life, how it changes lives, brings joy, is contagious, and is rooted in the confidence we have in God!

item.title: Good Friday: Come to the Table
item.itunes:subtitle: Good Friday 2023
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this special message, Pastor Doug Sauder takes us to the table where Jesus explained to His disciples using the Passover elements what was going to happen the very next day: His crucifixion and death. Discover what Jesus saw on the cross and why He had to die for us.
item.description: In this special message, Pastor Doug Sauder takes us to the table where Jesus explained to His disciples using the Passover elements what was going to happen the very next day: His crucifixion and death. Discover what Jesus saw on the cross and why He had to die for us.

item.title: Easter: Come and See
item.itunes:subtitle: Easter 2023
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: If the story of Jesus’ resurrection is actually true, what does that mean for your life today? In this special Easter message, Pastor Doug Sauder shares how the story of Jesus' resurrection has always been an invitation to discover God’s good plan for your life.
item.description: If the story of Jesus’ resurrection is actually true, what does that mean for your life today? In this special Easter message, Pastor Doug Sauder shares how the story of Jesus' resurrection has always been an invitation to discover God’s good plan for your life.

item.title: The Purpose of your Story
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In the final part of this special three-week series, we'll learn what it means to practically live in freedom and enjoy the more we were made for as we discover how God has a bigger and greater purpose for us, our story, and our future!

item.title: The Story of Your Heart
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In part two of this special series, we learn all about the heart. In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder shares about God's heart for us and how He heals, restores, and changes our heart.

item.title: The Story of Two Trees
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off this special three-part series, Pastor Doug Sauder explores the two trees in the center of the Garden of Eden and how a simple but powerful perspective shift can impact every area of your life.

item.title: Peace
item.itunes:subtitle: O Holy Night
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: During this Christmas message, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches us about what it means to have the peace of God despite our circumstances.

item.title: Finding Hope
item.itunes:subtitle: O Holy Night
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Continuing this special Christmas series," Plantation campus Pastor Chris Baselice examines the second verse of "O Holy Night," showing us what true hope is, how Jesus is the thrill of hope, and what that means for our weary world!

item.title: The Promise
item.itunes:subtitle: O Holy Night
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off this special series that will share the Christmas story through the lens of the classic carol "O Holy Night," Pastor Doug Sauder will explore the first verse of the song and how it reveals the promises of God that would be fulfilled in Jesus!

item.title: Our Mission
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: What will it take to reach the people in your city for Christ? In the final part of this special Church United series, Pastor Duane Roberts explores Matthew 9:35-38 and Jesus' prayer for the harvest and the workers. Discover how we can come together in prayer for God to put us on mission!

Discover how we can come together in prayer for God to put us on mission!

item.title: Our Unity
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What if we all prayed the same prayer at the same time? In part two of this special Church United series, Pastor Doug Sauder explores what unity in the Church is all about and share how to pray for unity like Jesus did using John 17 as our model.

item.title: His Kingdom
item.itunes:subtitle: As It Is In Heaven
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What if we all prayed the same prayer at the same time? In this series, which is being done in partnership with dozens of churches throughout South Florida, we’ll explore how we can pray like Jesus. In week one, Pastor Doug Sauder explores Jesus' model for us: The Lord's Prayer.

item.title: Face Your Chains With Confidence
item.itunes:subtitle: Whatever Happens
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off this special six-week study through the Book of Philippians, Pastor Doug Sauder breaks down Philippians 1:1–30. Discover how God always finishes what He starts, how His plan for us in this life and eternity is good, and how He redeems your trials and uses them to unite us and even free others!
item.description: Kicking off this special six-week study through the Book of Philippians, Pastor Doug Sauder breaks down Philippians 1:1–30. Discover how God always finishes what He starts, how His plan for us in this life and eternity is good, and how He redeems your trials and uses them to unite us and even free others!

Discover how God always finishes what He starts, how His plan for us in this life and eternity is good, and how He redeems your trials and uses them to unite us and even free others!

item.title: The Mindset of Christ
item.itunes:subtitle: Whatever Happens
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: How can we best represent Jesus to others? In this message, Calvary Chapel Plantation Pastor Chris Baselice will explore Philippians 2:1–11 and the power of humility! Together, we'll learn from Jesus’ example, understand why unity and service are vital to the life of a healthy church, and discover how we can put Christ's humility into practice!
item.description: How can we best represent Jesus to others? In this message, Calvary Chapel Plantation Pastor Chris Baselice will explore Philippians 2:1–11 and the power of humility! Together, we'll learn from Jesus’ example, understand why unity and service are vital to the life of a healthy church, and discover how we can put Christ's humility into practice!

item.title: Don't Get In The Way
item.itunes:subtitle: Whatever Happens
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: How does a Christian really grow in their faith? In this study, Pastor Doug Sauder breaks down Philippians 2:12–30 and teaches us the power of joyful service, how to press in to what God is doing, and how to walk in our God-given identity.
item.description: How does a Christian really grow in their faith? In this study, Pastor Doug Sauder breaks down Philippians 2:12–30 and teaches us the power of joyful service, how to press in to what God is doing, and how to walk in our God-given identity.

item.title: Keep Your Eye on the Prize
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever had a goal? Something important you were striving to accomplish? A prize you wanted to win? In this study, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Philippians 3 as we explore the goal of the Christian life! Discover where our confidence comes from, what is most valuable in the Christian life, and how to keep your eyes on the prize.

In this study, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Philippians 3 as we explore the goal of the Christian life! Discover where our confidence comes from, what is most valuable in the Christian life, and how to keep your eyes on the prize.

item.title: Fight God's Way
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week five of Philippians, Pastor Doug Sauder explores how we as believers can fight conflict, extremism, anxiety, toxic thinking, and apathy in a way honors the Lord and brings peace and joy in and around us.

item.title: You'll Have Enough
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What's the secret to being content, whatever happens? As we conclude our study through Philippians, Pastor Doug Sauder will share from Philippians 4:10–23. Learn how to live with contentment and satisfaction and how this propels us to joyful giving!

item.title: Vision Weekend: The Invitation
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In the second week of our special vision series, Pastor Doug shares how your story can be used by God to change lives!

item.title: Vision Weekend: The River
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: It's our favorite time of the year: Vision Weekends! In this special message, Pastor Doug Sauder shares from Ezekiel 47, as well as what the Lord has done through Calvary over the last year, where He's leading us in this new season, and how you can get in the story!

item.title: The Gospel + You
item.itunes:subtitle: Relationships and the Gospel
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What would happen if Jesus was at the center of every relationship in your life? This weekend, we'll kick off a special four-week study exploring how the gospel changes our lives and relationships. In week one, we'll discover the power of a relationship with Jesus in the areas of singleness, friendships, and dating.
item.description: What would happen if Jesus was at the center of every relationship in your life? This weekend, we'll kick off a special four-week study exploring how the gospel changes our lives and relationships. In week one, we'll discover the power of a relationship with Jesus in the areas of singleness, friendships, and dating.

item.title: The Gospel + Your Marriage
item.itunes:subtitle: Relationships and the Gospel
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What's the secret to a healthy and happy marriage? In week two of this special series, Pastor Doug Sauder examines what happens when Jesus is at the center of our marriage, how the gospel transforms this important relationship, and how we're called to live and love in light of it.
item.description: What's the secret to a healthy and happy marriage? In week two of this special series, Pastor Doug Sauder examines what happens when Jesus is at the center of our marriage, how the gospel transforms this important relationship, and how we're called to live and love in light of it.

In week two of this special series, Pastor Doug Sauder examines what happens when Jesus is at the center of our marriage, how the gospel transforms this important relationship, and how we're called to live and love in light of it.

item.title: The Gospel + Your Family
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: How does the gospel transform our families? In part three of “Relationships and the Gospel,” Pastor Doug Sauder explains how God uses family to form us, what happens when Jesus is at the center of these important relationships, how He can redeem and restore our relationships, and how we can glorify Him in difficult and dysfunctional situations.

In part three of “Relationships and the Gospel,” Pastor Doug Sauder explains how God uses family to form us, what happens when Jesus is at the center of these important relationships, how He can redeem and restore our relationships, and how we can glorify Him in difficult and dysfunctional situations.

item.title: The Gospel + Your Work
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In the final part of our series, “Relationships and the Gospel,” we’ll examine how the gospel impacts our work as well as our relationships with our coworkers and those in the world! Discover how work is part of our purpose as people and how our work has a divine purpose.

item.title: Deliverance
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 1 - The Call
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off an epic 26-week series through the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder explores Exodus 1 as we discover how the Lord was weaving redemption and deliverance for His people all along, what happens when you fear the Lord, and where true freedom us found.
item.description: Kicking off an epic 26-week series through the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder explores Exodus 1 as we discover how the Lord was weaving redemption and deliverance for His people all along, what happens when you fear the Lord, and where true freedom us found.

item.title: Losing Yourself
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 1 - The Call
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What do you do when you feel like you’ve lost yourself? Where do you go? In week two of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder dives into chapter 2 and shares what it means to rediscover our identity and purpose as we read stories about Moses, his birth mother, and his adopted mother.
item.description: What do you do when you feel like you’ve lost yourself? Where do you go? In week two of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder dives into chapter 2 and shares what it means to rediscover our identity and purpose as we read stories about Moses, his birth mother, and his adopted mother.

item.title: Paying Attention
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 1 - The Call
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever had a conversation or encounter that changed your life? In week three of our study through Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder unpacks Exodus 2:21–3:15 as we explore the encounter that changed Moses’ life and the whole world: meeting God in the burning bush!
item.description: Have you ever had a conversation or encounter that changed your life? In week three of our study through Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder unpacks Exodus 2:21–3:15 as we explore the encounter that changed Moses’ life and the whole world: meeting God in the burning bush!

item.title: What's In Your Hand?
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 1 - The Call
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: "Can God really use me?" In week four of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Duane Roberts of Calvary Chapel Boynton Beach unpacks Exodus 3:16–4:17 as we see the Lord reveal His power and plan to Moses, inviting him and us to consider what's in our hands, hearts, past, or present that God wants to use to accomplish His awesome work in the world.
item.description: "Can God really use me?" In week four of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Duane Roberts of Calvary Chapel Boynton Beach unpacks Exodus 3:16–4:17 as we see the Lord reveal His power and plan to Moses, inviting him and us to consider what's in our hands, hearts, past, or present that God wants to use to accomplish His awesome work in the world.

item.title: Walk On
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 2 - Free My People
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever had to take a big step of faith? Something that required boldness and courage? In week five of The Book of Exodus, Pastor Chris Baselice of Calvary Chapel Plantation unpacks Exodus 4:18–6 as we see Moses return to Egypt to confront Pharaoh with a simple message: "Let my people go."
item.description: Have you ever had to take a big step of faith? Something that required boldness and courage? In week five of The Book of Exodus, Pastor Chris Baselice of Calvary Chapel Plantation unpacks Exodus 4:18–6 as we see Moses return to Egypt to confront Pharaoh with a simple message: "Let my people go."

item.title: Heart Of Stone
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 2 - Free My People
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week six of the Book of Exodus, we unpack Exodus 7:14–10:20 as Pastor Doug Sauder unpacks the 10 plagues of Egypt and what they represent. In this message, we'll see­ God’s power on full display contrasted with Pharaoh’s hard-heartedness, and discover how we can experience freedom in this area as well.

item.title: When The Lights Go Out
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 2 - Free My People
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week six of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder unpacks Exodus 10:21–11:10 as we arrive at the final two plagues: the plagues of darkness and death.

item.title: Passover
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 2 - Free My People
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week eight of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder takes us through Exodus 12:1–30 and the Passover as we unpack one of the most beautiful and clearest parallels to the gospel of Jesus found in the Old Testament.

item.title: The Walk To Freedom
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 3 - Our Freedom Story
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week nine of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Exodus 12:31-13:22. In this message, we journey with the Israelites from Egypt to the Red Sea and discover how our freedom is won!
item.description: In week nine of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Exodus 12:31-13:22. In this message, we journey with the Israelites from Egypt to the Red Sea and discover how our freedom is won!

item.title: The Impossible Place
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 3 - Our Freedom Story
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever been in a situation where you felt like you had your back against the wall? As a believer, what are we called to do in those situations? In week 10 of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Exodus 14 as the Israelites cross the Red Sea. Discover how the Lord both leads us to those moments and leads us through them, all the while bringing about good and being glorified in it!

item.title: Our Freedom Song
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 3 - Our Freedom Story
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week 11 of the Book of Exodus, we’ll take a unique look at Exodus 15 as Pastor Doug Sauder takes us through the songs of Moses and Miriam. In this worship celebration service, you'll discover the heart of worship and how God fights for us through these songs of freedom.

item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 3 - Our Freedom Story
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: In week 12 of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Duane Roberts of the Boynton Beach campus shares from Exodus 16 as we see the Lord provide bread from heaven for the Israelites in the wilderness!

item.title: Choosing Faith To See Freedom
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 3 - Our Freedom Story
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In week 13 of the Book of Exodus, Calvary Chapel Plantation's Pastor Chris Baselice teaches from Exodus 17. In this message, we see the Lord not only provides water from a rock for the people in the desert, but also bring them victory in battle. Discover how obedience to Him and His call on your life enables you to see victory in your life!

In this message, we see the Lord not only provides water from a rock for the people in the desert, but also bring them victory in battle. Discover how obedience to Him and His call on your life enables you to see victory in your life!
item.content:encoded: In week 13 of the Book of Exodus, Calvary Chapel Plantation's Pastor Chris Baselice teaches from Exodus 17. In this message, we see the Lord not only provides water from a rock for the people in the desert, but also bring them victory in battle. Discover how obedience to Him and His call on your life enables you to see victory in your life!

item.title: Embracing Limits
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 3 - Our Freedom Story
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week 14 of the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Exodus 18. In this message, we see Moses meet with his father-in-law and get some great counsel. Discover the importance of mentorship and surrounding yourself with great community!

item.title: The Ten Commandments
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 4 - Of Laws and Love
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever wondered what it means to live in right relationship with God and others? Continuing our study through the Book of Exodus, Pastor Doug Sauder examines Exodus 20 as we discover the purpose of the 10 commandments, how they draw us to Jesus, and how they instruct us to the best life humanly possible!

item.title: The Other 603
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt.4 - Of Laws and Love
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, we explore Exodus 21–23 as the Lord continues giving Moses the law. Discover how the Lord shaped His people through this law to set them apart and bring about the coming of Jesus, and how this law impacts us today.

item.title: A Promise Of Freedom
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt.4 - Of Laws and Love
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Where does our confidence come from as believers? In part 18 of our study through Exodus, Pastor Chris Baselice of Calvary Chapel Plantation breaks down Exodus 23:20–24:18. Discover how God fights for us, why it's important to live out our relationship with Jesus in community, and how to be rooted in the truth of God’s Word.

item.title: The Father's Presence
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt.5 - A House For God
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: One of the best gifts a dad can give his kids is his presence! This Father's Day weekend, Pastor Duane Roberts from Calvary Chapel Boynton Beach explores the Tabernacle— the place where God's presence would live. Discover how this ancient tent points to the coming of Jesus and His work in our lives.

item.title: Translating God
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt.5 - A House For God
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Who can stand before God? In this special communion message, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Exodus 28–31 as we discover what holiness is all about, what it means to be a messenger of the gospel to those around us, and how God equips us with gifts, passions, and situations to do His work in the world!

In this special communion message, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Exodus 28–31 as we discover what holiness is all about, what it means to be a messenger of the gospel to those around us, and how God equips us with gifts, passions, and situations to do His work in the world!

item.title: Golden Calf
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt.6 - On Idols and Irons
item.itunes:summary: What does idolatry look like today, and how do you know if you’re struggling with it? In week 21 of our study through the Book of Exodus, Boca campus Pastor Jerry Sander teaches from Exodus 32 as we explore the Israelites’ construction of a golden calf idol. Learn how to identify and avoid the things in life that fight for our attention and affection.

item.title: Seeing God
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt.6 - On Idols and Irons
item.itunes:author: Stephan Tchividjian
item.itunes:summary: What’s it like to see God face-to-face? In week 22 of our study through the Book of Exodus, Pastor Stephan Tchividjian dives into Exodus 33 as we learn about the tabernacle (the tent of meeting) where the presence of God would dwell among His people. Learn how we can live in and be guided by God’s presence every day!

item.title: The God Of Second Chances
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt.6 - On Idols and Irons
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever felt like you needed a second chance? In this special message, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Exodus 34 as we learn about the remaking of the Ten Commandment tablets. Discover the patience and mercy of God to give us second chances and how God's presence transforms us.

item.title: A Heart For God's House
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt.7 - For God's Glory
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What does generosity look like in action? In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder shares from Exodus 35–36 as we discover where true generosity flows from, why it’s an act of worship that brings joy and fulfillment, and the different expressions of generosity we can engage in as believers.

item.title: Divine Blueprint
item.itunes:subtitle: Exodus Pt. 7 - For God's Glory
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Don't you sometimes wish you had a simple blueprint for life? As we continue our study through Exodus, we'll learn how the details in the tabernacle point us toward a greater reality, explore God’s provision and redemption, and discover how to live on mission bringing the presence of Christ with us wherever we go!

item.itunes:summary: Kicking off a five-week study through this powerful Old Testament book, in this message Pastor Doug teaches from Micah 1–2, exploring God's nature as just judge and merciful Savior. Discover how even in an increasing dark world, God's mercy, grace, and goodness shine through and triumph over evil.

item.title: Jesus the Finisher
item.itunes:author: Stephan Tchividjian
item.itunes:summary: This special communion weekend, our study through the Gospel of Mark takes us to Mark 15:1–41 as we relive the trial, crucifixion, death, and burial of Jesus. Learn why Jesus had to die, reflect on the Lord's ultimate sacrifice on our behalf, and remember how deep His love for you runs!

item.title: Failing Forward
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 14:43-72
item.itunes:author: Alan Platt
item.itunes:summary: What does life after failure look like for you? We've all failed at some point, but how do we move forward? In this message, special guest Alan Platt teaches from Mark 14:43-72 as we examine the failures of Judas and Peter, how failure can either lead to redemption or destruction, and how God can use your failures to redeem you!

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder

item.title: Jesus and the Endgame
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 13
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Does the future make you anxious? Do you ever wonder about the end of the world? Continuing our study through the Gospel of Mark, Pastor Doug teaches from Mark 13 as Jesus tackles the end times. Learn the realities of what’s to come, but also the comfort and eternal security of knowing Jesus both today and in the future!

item.title: Jesus Goes Public: Trapping Jesus
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 12:18-44
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever felt trapped, unprepared, or blindsided by someone else or by a situation you were put in? As we study Mark 12:18-44, Jesus will not only demonstrate how we can handle ourselves in those moments, but also reveal how we can live free and help others to do the same!

item.title: Gloves Off
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 11:1–26
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Gospel of Mark, we dive into Mark 11:1–26 and Jesus’ triumphal entry into Jerusalem as well as the cursing of the fig tree. In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder shares how Jesus’ version of power, anger, and judgment looks very different from the worldly version and how we as Christians can follow His example.

item.title: Jesus Redefines Priorities
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 10:17–31
item.itunes:summary: Do you want to be rich? Who doesn’t, right? What does it take to be rich? Continuing our study through the Gospel of Mark, we explore Mark 10:17–31. In this message, Pastor Jerry Sander shares Jesus’ secret to being truly rich, how we can experience life in all its richness, how neither religion nor riches nor personal righteousness can get you into heaven, and how we can align our priorities to His.
item.description: Do you want to be rich? Who doesn’t, right? What does it take to be rich? Continuing our study through the Gospel of Mark, we explore Mark 10:17–31. item.title: Jesus on Marriage and Divorce
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 10:1-16
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What does the Bible say about marriage and divorce? Is there hope for struggling couples or those who have walked through divorce? This past weekend, we continued our study through the Gospel of Mark as Pastor Doug Sauder broke down Mark 10:1–16. In this message, we discover the meaning of marriage and what the Bible has to say about honoring the Lord in singleness and in marriage. We also explore Jesus’ thoughts on divorce and hear about the hope Jesus offers for struggling couples and for those who are or have already been divorced.

item.title: Jesus Redefines Greatness
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 9:30-50
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: “How do I achieve greatness in my life?” It's a question we all wrestle with as we consider what our life will be. Continuing our study through the Gospel of Mark, Pastor Duane Roberts of our Boynton Beach campus shares a powerful word from Mark 9:30–50. In this message, we find out what true greatness actually looks like according to Jesus and are given clear biblical steps to achieving it!

item.title: The God Who Gives Sight
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 8:22–38
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Who do you say Jesus is? How do you see Him? Continuing our in-depth study through the Gospel of Mark, Pastor Doug shares a powerful word from Mark 8:22–38. In this message, we see Jesus getting personal and walking a blind man through a process of healing, we explore the cost of following Jesus, and come face to face with the question of who Jesus truly is.

item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 6:1-29
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In part nine of our study through the Gospel of Mark, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Mark 6:1–29. In this message, we see how Jesus was and still is misunderstood, how He teaches us to deal with being misunderstood because of our faith, and how we can trust and depend on Him regardless of our circumstances.

item.title: The God Who Asks Questions
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 2:18–3:6
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, we saw how Jesus dealt with people who sought to trap and discredit Him. We learned why Jesus constantly answered questions with questions, how His questions would draw out the true heart of people, why He invited honest questions, and why He is the answer to our deepest questions.

item.title: God in Sandals
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 1:21-45
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Gospel of Mark, Pastor Doug teaches from Mark 1:21-45—the beginning of Jesus’ ministry through the region of Galilee. In this message, we discover why Jesus’ words have authority over our lives, what He used His authority for, how it fueled His mission, and how it can change your life!

item.title: Mark's Jesus Story
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 1:1–20
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off a study through the Gospel of Mark, Pastor Doug Sauder examines Jesus' baptism and temptation, the beginnings of His ministry, and the calling of His first disciples, showing us that Jesus is the center of the story and He’s inviting us into His story!

item.title: Good Friday: Comeback
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 15:1-39
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this special Good Friday message, Pastor Doug Sauder explores the events that led to Jesus' crucifixion as we are invited to reflect on His goodness and grace and take communion together.

item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 16:1-8
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this Easter message, we celebrate the greatest comeback of all time as Pastor Doug Sauder shares how the resurrection of Jesus has changed the world and has the power to change our story for all time.

item.title: Hope Beyond Grief
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 25
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off "Origins Part 3: The Dreamers," Pastor Doug Sauder shares a powerful word from Genesis 25 about what we can learn from grief and loss, how to move forward after mourning, and why it's important to think twice before trading what you need most for what you want now.
item.description: Kicking off "Origins Part 3: The Dreamers," Pastor Doug Sauder shares a powerful word from Genesis 25 about what we can learn from grief and loss, how to move forward after mourning, and why it's important to think twice before trading what you need most for what you want now.

item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 27
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through “Origins: The Dreamers,” Pastor Doug teaches from Genesis 27. In this message, we'll discover why we all long for the blessing of God, why you can’t steal a blessing, and how blessings are truly received.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Watch this special night of prayer and worship as we grieve together with our family, hear from Boynton campus worship leader Joshua Sherman, spend time worshiping Jesus, and pray over what is going on throughout our country and world.

item.title: Is the Dream Out of Reach?
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 28
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through “Origins: The Dreamers,” Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Genesis 28. In this message, we explore the vision that has come to be known as “Jacob’s ladder” and how it points us to the work of God in Christ Jesus. We also explore the generosity and faithfulness of God.

item.itunes:author: Bob Barnes, Doug Sauder, Steve Mayo

item.title: Wrestling with God
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 32
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through “Origins: The Dreamers,” Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Genesis 32. In this message, we explore one of the most famous moments in the Old Testament: the moment Jacob wrestled with God. Receive encouragement as we discover that we're not alone in our struggles, that God is always with us, and that when we struggle with God, it transforms our struggle with others!

item.title: The Drifting Dreamer
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 34-35
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Book of Genesis, Pastor Chris Baselice of our Plantation campus shares a powerful and difficult word from Genesis 34 and 35 about remembering. Together, we’ll discover how to return to God and how to remain anchored in Jesus.

item.title: The Dreamer
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 37
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Book of Genesis, Pastor Duane Roberts from our Boynton Beach campus teaches from Genesis 37. In this message, we begin our exploration of one of the most fascinating stories in all of Scripture: the life of Joseph.

item.title: Fighting Temptation
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Book of Genesis, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Genesis 39. In this message, we look at the story of Joseph and Potiphar’s wife, receive some very practical and biblical action steps to help us fight temptations, and understand why honoring God doesn’t always lead to immediate blessings.
item.description: Continuing our study through the Book of Genesis, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Genesis 39. item.title: Who Is the Hero of Your Dream?
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 40
item.itunes:author: Javan Shashaty
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Book of Genesis, Fort Lauderdale campus HSM leader Javan Shashaty teaches from Genesis 40. In this message, we explore the story of Joseph interpreting the dreams of Pharaoh’s cupbearer and baker in prison and discover how God uses difficult situations in our lives to show us something.

item.title: Ready for the Moment
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 41-42
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Book of Genesis, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Genesis 41 and 42. In this message, we explore the power of moments as we see that nothing can stop God’s good plans, why good moments should always carry more weight in our lives than the bad moments, and how we can be prepared for the moment when God’s plan becomes reality.

item.title: Getting Unstuck
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 42–45
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, we’ll see the full interaction between Joseph and his brothers play out. Watch as God’s plan of salvation for Joseph and his family comes full circle.

item.title: More
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 45-48
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Book of Genesis, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches from Genesis 45–48. In this message, we discover why God gives and takes away for His purposes, how He uses adversity to prepare us for abundance, and how His purposes and plans are always for our ultimate good.

item.title: Speak the Blessing
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 49
item.itunes:author: Allan Platt
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Book of Genesis, special guest Alan Platt takes us through Genesis 49. In this message, we take a look at Jacob’s final blessing to his sons and why it’s so important to speak the blessings of God over one another.

item.title: Special Night of Prayer and Worship
item.itunes:summary: Watch along with us as we lift up praise and worship to the Lord and spend time in prayer for our world in this season. Hear from different leaders as we discuss the pandemic and everything it has impacted, as well as issues of racism, justice, and reconciliation.

item.title: The End of the Beginning
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 50
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In the conclusion of our study through the Book of Genesis, Pastor Doug shares a powerful word from Genesis 50. In this message, we’ll see how the gospel is present in all of Genesis, how this book and the life of Joseph point us to Jesus, and how God can redeem the darkest moments in our lives.

item.title: Week 6: Why and How Do I Read the Bible?
item.itunes:summary: In part six of Alpha, we’ll discover what the Bible is, why it’s necessary for us to read it, and how to engage with it.

item.itunes:summary: In week one of this special six-week class series, Pastor Doug Sauder shares how we were designed by God for community, how the Church is a family, and how we can strengthen and comfort one another in seasons of crisis and tragedy.

item.title: I Need a Miracle
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark 9
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off “Miracles,” a special nine-part series, Pastor Doug explains what a miracle is, how miracles still happen today, why we’re all candidates for miracles, what miracles can look like in the midst of it, and the role of prayer and fasting in the miraculous.
item.description: Kicking off “Miracles,” a special nine-part series, Pastor Doug explains what a miracle is, how miracles still happen today, why we’re all candidates for miracles, what miracles can look like in the midst of it, and the role of prayer and fasting in the miraculous.

item.title: Night of Prayer & Worship
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: It’s time to take a breather from all the news cycles, social media feeds, and podcasts and breathe in the goodness of God through a time of prayer and worship. We hope this rebroadcast from one of Pastor Doug’s favorite Nights of Prayer and Worship can be a balm for your soul, a chance to say “no” to anxiety and fear and “yes” to the presence and peace of Jesus!

item.title: Church United Night of Worship
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: As we get ready for an unprecedented and unique Easter around the world, be part of this powerful night of prayer and worship hosted by various pastors from the different churches that are part of Church United and led by Village Hymns. Hear from Pastor Doug Sauder, Pastor Virgil Sierra of Vertical Church, Pastor Rob Pacienza of Coral Ridge Presbyterian Church, Pastor Brian Brookins of Riverside Church, Pastor James Welch of First Baptist Church of Fort Lauderdale, Pastor Steven Lee of Legacy Church, and Church United Director Eddie Copeland.

item.title: Easter: The Miracle of the Resurrection
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this special Easter message, we celebrate the day when hope came alive as we examine the greatest miracle the world has ever known: the miracle of Jesus' resurrection! Discover the power of the resurrection, which allows us to enjoy an abundant life today and an everlasting life in heaven!

item.title: Revealer of Mysteries: A Study Through Daniel
item.itunes:subtitle: Trailer
item.itunes:summary:
How can we be faithful to God in a world that increasingly rejects Him? How can we live above the fray in turbulent times?How should God’s people, as the cultural minority, interact with the world? These questions are at the forefront of the Church today, but they aren’t new. It’s the same struggle God’s people were facing in the Book of Daniel!

In this series, we’ll explore one of the most powerful, relevant books of the Bible and discover how to survive, thrive, and experience breakthrough in a hostile culture. We’ll also examine some extremely important prophecies and visions God gave regarding His purposes and plans.

item.title: Living with Purpose
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 1
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off our study through the Book of Daniel, Pastor Doug shares from Daniel 1, 2 Chronicles 36, and Jeremiah 28. In this message, we discover that God's purposes will always prevail, that God has a purpose for each and every one of us, and that strong godly convictions can lead to breakthrough in the lives of others.

item.title: Living With Conviction
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 1
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Continuing the discussion from part one of "Revealer of Mysteries," Pastor Chris Baselice of the Plantation campus shares a deep dive into Daniel 1, showing us that conviction is a matter of the heart, helps foster courage in us, and is strengthened in community with others.

item.title: Better Than Your Wildest Dreams
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 2
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our “Revealer of Mysteries: A Study Through Daniel,” Pastor Chris Baselice of our Plantation campus takes us through Daniel 2. In this message, we examine the dream God gave Nebuchadnezzar, the situation surrounding it, and how the Lord revealed the mystery to Daniel. We also explore the revelation of God and how we can walk in the dreams He gives us!

item.title: Missions Week Kick-Off Night
item.itunes:author: Paul Walker
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off Missions Week, watch as a panel of our international strategic partners share an update about how God has been moving and working in their respective ministries, and where they're headed.

item.title: The Dream of the Kingdom
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 2:31–49
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our “Revealer of Mysteries” study, Pastor Doug Sauder breaks down Daniel 2:31–49. Picking up where we left off last week with King Nebuchadnezzar’s dream, in this message we see the dream revealed and then its interpretation. As part of Missions Week, we also get to here from some of our global missionaries whom the Lord is using to continue building His kingdom and reach the lost!

item.title: Stand
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 3
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing “Revealer of Mysteries: A Study Through Daniel,” Pastor Doug Sauder explores King Nebuchadnezzar's response to his dream in Daniel 3. In this message, we take a deep dive into one of the most compelling and powerful stories in the Old Testament and discover how the Lord showed up in this moment, how He shows up in our lives today, and how we can stand firm in our convictions, even in the face of persecution and the temptations of the world.

item.title: Standing For Life
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug is joined by Ariana Reed from Hope Women's Center to discuss the sanctity of life, and how we as believers can be both advocates for life and still show compassion, love, and grace.

item.title: The Mad King's Diary
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 4
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Book of Daniel, Pastor Doug Sauder shares from Daniel 4. In this message, we dive into one of the most interesting chapters in all the Bible, a chapter written by pagan King Nebuchadnezzar. Get a firsthand view of where pridefulness ultimately leads, and see God's gracious hand and power to restore!

item.title: The Writing on the Wall
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 5
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week seven of our series, “Revealer of Mysteries: A Study Through Daniel,” Pastor Doug Sauder shares from Daniel 5. In this message, we see the Babylonian Empire come to an end as the Lord used Daniel to deliver a powerful message and discover why the fear of the Lord is so powerful and of paramount importance in the life of a believer.

item.title: The Lion's Den
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 6
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In part seven of “Revealer of Mysteries: A Study Through Daniel,” Pastor Doug Sauder shares from Daniel 6. In this message, we take a look at one of the most famous and powerful stories in all of Scripture: the epic story of Daniel and the lion's den. We examine the circumstances, how God worked for Daniels' good and His glory, and get to see a beautiful portrait of the gospel in these events.

item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 6
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Jerry Sander from our Boca campus expanded on Daniel 6 and encourages us to stay clean, stay close, stay calm, stay committed, and stay connected.

item.title: The Ancient of Days
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 2 & 7
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In part eight of "Revealer of Mysteries," Pastor Doug Sauder shares from Daniel 7 as we begin our journey through the prophetic section of this powerful Old Testament book. In this message, we revisit the prophecy from Daniel 2, but this time instead of seeing the image comprised of different precious metals (Nebuchadnezzar's perspective), we examine it as four horrifying beasts (Daniel's perspective).

item.content:encoded: In part eight of "Revealer of Mysteries," Pastor Doug Sauder shares from Daniel 7 as we begin our journey through the prophetic section of this powerful Old Testament book. In this message, we revisit the prophecy from Daniel 2, but this time instead of seeing the image comprised of different precious metals (Nebuchadnezzar's perspective), we examine it as four horrifying beasts (Daniel's perspective).

item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 8
item.itunes:author: Bill Schott
item.itunes:summary: Continuing to make our way through the prophetic section of Daniel, CCA Bible Department Head Pastor Bill Schott shares from Daniel 8 and the vision of the ram and the goat and what it all means.

item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel 9
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our “Revealer of Mysteries: A Study Through Daniel,” series, Pastor Doug Sauder shares from Daniel 9, one of the most significant prophetic passages in the Bible. In this message, we explore the power of prayer, the manner in which God hears and answers our prayers, and how prophecy always points us to Jesus!

item.title: Unsinkable: Truth
item.itunes:subtitle: Week 1: Jeremiah 17 & John 18
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off "Unsinkable," a special four-week series in tandem with over 45 other churches throughout South Florida, Pastor Doug Sauder explores the idea of truth. In this message, we discover that there is such a thing as absolute truth, but it's not found within; it's found in the Bible.
item.description: Kicking off "Unsinkable," a special four-week series in tandem with over 45 other churches throughout South Florida, Pastor Doug Sauder explores the idea of truth. In this message, we discover that there is such a thing as absolute truth, but it's not found within; it's found in the Bible.

In this message, we discover that there is such a thing as absolute truth, but it's not found within; it's found in the Bible.

item.title: Unsinkable: God
item.itunes:subtitle: Week 2: Isaiah 40 & 6:1-7
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Does God exist? How can I know for sure? If He does, how can I know Him? In week two of "Unsinkable," Pastor Doug shows us that God is real and worthy of our worship, that He is a knowable, self-revealing God who pursues us, and explains how we can know Him and why we can trust Him.

item.itunes:subtitle: Week 3: John 4
item.itunes:author: Isaac Frere
item.itunes:summary: In this message, special guest Pastor Isaac Frere of The Font, an online ministry that emerged into communities of believers in cities around the country, shares a powerful word about what the gospel is and what the gospel does as we continue to make our way through the core foundational elements of our faith in "Unsinkable."

item.title: Unsinkable: Mission
item.itunes:subtitle: Colossians 1
item.itunes:author: Allan Platt
item.itunes:summary: As Christians, we’re all part of something bigger than ourselves: the Church. That means, we’re part of the greatest mission on earth. As we conclude this special four-week Church United series alongside 45 other churches in South Florida, special guest Pastor Alan Platt unpacks the mission of the Church and how our Lord Jesus equips us and works through us to carry it out!

item.title: Unsinkable, Church United Night of Worship
item.itunes:summary: Wrapping up Love South Florida, a month-long effort where churches from all around the tri-county area unite to love, give, and serve our community, this very special night of prayer and worship with various churches from all over Broward County is all about celebrating the Lord’s amazing work and the lives that were changed through Love South Florida.

item.title: Imperfect Timing
item.itunes:subtitle: Luke 1
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In part one of "Imperfect Christmas," Pastor Doug Sauder walks us through the circumstances and timing chosen by God to bring about the Messiah. From the birth of John the Baptist to the immaculate conception of Mary, and the response from both Mary and Joseph to God’s will and plan, we'll see how the Lord’s timing is perfect and how He never wastes a single moment.

item.title: Imperfect Places
item.itunes:subtitle: Luke 2
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week two of our special holiday series, "Imperfect Christmas," Pastor Doug Sauder explores the seemingly imperfect setting of the Christmas story as well as some other imperfect places that the Lord used throughout history. In this message, we get to see how God uses imperfect places to do extraordinary things, how he turns imperfect places into holy ground, and what all of this means for our lives!

item.title: Rethinking Sexuality One-Day Conference with Dr. Juli Slattery
item.itunes:subtitle: Part 1 of 3
item.itunes:author: Juli Slattery
item.itunes:summary: Watch Dr. Juli Slattery, renowned expert on sexuality and biblical truth, share a fresh perspective on how we can experience sexuality in a way that honors God. In this conference, you’ll learn how every sexual question is ultimately a spiritual one, discover why sexuality not as a problem to solve but as a territory to reclaim, see how sexuality is rooted in the broader context of God's heart for us, and grasp the bigger picture of sexual challenges and wholeness.

item.title: Rethinking Sexuality: God's Design and Why It Matters
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Dr. Juli Slattery
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder, Juli Slattery
item.itunes:summary:
Kicking off a three-week series titled “Sexuality and the Gospel,” Pastor Doug Sauder is joined by Dr. Juli Slattery, celebrated author and founder of Authentic Intimacy. In this message and Q&A session, Pastor Doug and Dr. Slattery explore the truth about our sexuality, expose the damaging cultural narratives, and walk us through God’s perfect promises and plan for our sexuality.

Note: As you walk through this series with us, we encourage you to read these passages from the Bible to give you a richer understanding of God's plan and purpose for sexuality: Genesis 1-2; Song of Solomon; Hosea 6–7; Matthew 19; Romans 1; and 1 Corinthians 6–7.
item.description:
Kicking off a three-week series titled “Sexuality and the Gospel,” Pastor Doug Sauder is joined by Dr. Juli Slattery, celebrated author and founder of Authentic Intimacy. In this message and Q&A session, Pastor Doug and Dr. Slattery explore the truth about our sexuality, expose the damaging cultural narratives, and walk us through God’s perfect promises and plan for our sexuality.

Note: As you walk through this series with us, we encourage you to read these passages from the Bible to give you a richer understanding of God's plan and purpose for sexuality: Genesis 1-2; Song of Solomon; Hosea 6–7; Matthew 19; Romans 1; and 1 Corinthians 6–7.
item.content:encoded:
Kicking off a three-week series titled “Sexuality and the Gospel,” Pastor Doug Sauder is joined by Dr. Juli Slattery, celebrated author and founder of Authentic Intimacy. In this message and Q&A session, Pastor Doug and Dr. Slattery explore the truth about our sexuality, expose the damaging cultural narratives, and walk us through God’s perfect promises and plan for our sexuality.

Note: As you walk through this series with us, we encourage you to read these passages from the Bible to give you a richer understanding of God's plan and purpose for sexuality: Genesis 1-2; Song of Solomon; Hosea 6–7; Matthew 19; Romans 1; and 1 Corinthians 6–7.

item.title: Sexual Integrity for Singles and Married Couples
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Watch as Pastor Doug and a panel of leaders explore how the gospel impacts one's sexuality, the difficulties the of sexual brokenness we all experience to some degree, and how the Lord is able to bring peace and joy through sexual integrity.

item.title: Holy Sexuality
item.itunes:subtitle: Genesis 1, Matthew 19, 1 Corinthians 6-7
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week two of this special series, Pastor Doug explores what holy sexuality looks like. In this message, we discover the framework for Christians to be able to honor the Lord sexually despite living in a fallen and sexually broken world, whether we're single, married, divorced, widowed, or physically unable to express your sexual desire. We also learn that our whole life changes when we stop looking for identity on the outside and embrace our God-given identity.

item.title: Out of a Far Country
item.itunes:subtitle: Part 1 of 2
item.itunes:author: Christopher Yuan, Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Concluding our "Sexuality and the Gospel" series, we're joined by Moody Bible Institute professor, author, and speaker Dr. Christopher Yuan. In this message, we'll hear Dr. Yuan, who once identified as gay and agnostic, and his parents, Dr. Leon and Angela, share their journey of redemption and restoration, and what it means to walk in holy sexuality.

item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice

item.title: Jesus + Nothing = Everything

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our “Live Free” series through the Book of Galatians, Pastor Doug Sauder dives into Galatians 3 and shows us how the gospel is enough for salvation, why faith—and not works of the law—is what makes us righteous, and explores the purpose of the law and validity of God’s promises.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message on Galatians 4, Pastor Doug Sauder explains how freedom is a fragile gift we must fight to hold onto, how Christians can wind up wasting their freedom in Christ, and how walking in true freedom leads to joy.

In this message, we'll break down one of the most fascinating and profound stories in the entire Bible: the binding of Isaac, how it points to Jesus, and how we can walk in faith as Abraham did.

item.title: The Parable of the Seed
item.itunes:subtitle: Matthew 13, Mark 4 & Luke 8
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off our weekend parables study, Pastor Doug shares a powerful word from one of Jesus’ most notable stories, the Parable of the Sower. In this message, we explore the power of a story, the four types of people Jesus is alluding to in this parable and where each of them stand in relation to Him, and how God wants to use us to sow seeds in the lives of the people around us.

item.itunes:subtitle: Romans 8 & Matthew 28
item.itunes:summary: In the final week of our sanctuary class series on spiritual gifts, Pastor Jerry Sander of our Boca campus teaches about the journey of developing your gifts. Find out what it practically looks like to put your faith and gifts into action as the Lord uses you to build His kingdom!

item.itunes:subtitle: Matthew 21 & Isaiah 5
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug walks us through the events of Good Friday as we take a reflective look at the work of Jesus Christ through the lens of the Parable of the Wicked Vinedressers.

item.title: Easter Sunday: There is More to the Story
item.itunes:subtitle: John 19, 20 & Romans 8
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, we celebrate the resurrection of Jesus and discover that the chapter we’re in is not the end of our story because Jesus has so much more in store for us. Examining the perspectives of Mary Magdalene, Thomas, and Mary the mother of Jesus, we see how the resurrection changes everything for us and gives our stories new meaning and purpose.

item.title: Prepare the Promise
item.itunes:subtitle: Joshua 1 & 1 Corinthians 10
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In the first message of our series, “Taking Ground," Pastor Doug shares from Joshua 1 as Joshua is appointed leader of the people of Israel and given an amazing encouragement by God. We also explore how both God’s command and His promise to Joshua apply to us!

item.itunes:subtitle: Joshua 1, 2Timothy 3 & Luke 4
item.itunes:summary: In this message from Boca campus Pastor Jerry Sander, we'll explore practical tips and best practices for creating a consistent habit of studying and meditating on God’s Word.

item.itunes:subtitle: Joshua 2 & Romans 10
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In week two of our study through Joshua, Pastor Chris Baselice of our Plantation campus shares a powerful word from Joshua 2. In this message, we'll discover how God used an unlikely hero named Rahab, and how He wants to use you, no matter who you are or what you’ve done, to take ground and change the world.

item.itunes:subtitle: Joshua 2
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug is joined by a panel to discuss some of the themes from Joshua 2, taking a deeper look into unlikely people God has used in amazing ways, both then and now!

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug will be sharing an update on Vision 2023 as we explore Joshua 3 and 4, the crossing of the Jordan, and the amazing work God did among the Israelites.

item.title: Remembering Your Miracles
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Reuben Ramsaran
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Reuben Ramsaran shares a powerful word about remembering all that God has done in our lives. We also discuss the importance of journaling and how we can set up our own "stones of remembrance.”

item.title: Barefoot
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: As we continue our "Taking Ground" series, Pastor Doug explores Joshua 5 and the amazing and holy moment that took place just before the Israelites took the city of Jericho. In this message, we'll discover the importance of what took place at Gilgal and how we see the resurrection of Jesus parallel this moment.

item.title: The Invisible Made Visible
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Chris Baselice of our Plantation campus shares a powerful word about how Jesus is a warrior who fights for us, a friend who suffers with us, and a Savior who rescues us.

item.title: Walls Fall Down
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, we explore the power of faith and obedience to the Lord even when we don’t understand and how faith allows us to share in God’s victories with Him. We also discover why we all have a Jericho in our lives and how the Lord wants to knock down walls and use us to take ground for His kingdom.

item.title: Don't Bury Your Secret
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our "Taking Ground" series, Pastor Doug shares a powerful, timely message from Joshua 7. In this message, we see the secret sin of Achan catch up to him and lead to the deaths of 36 men, showing us that our sin doesn’t just hurt us and will never stay buried. We also discover the importance of accountability and confession.

item.title: Learning From Achan
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Reuben Ramsaran
item.itunes:summary: Continuing the discussion started with "Don't Bury Your Secret," Pastor Reuben Ramsaran takes a deeper dive into Achan's sin, how dangerous and easy the path into temptation can be, and how we can flee from temptation and press into the Lord in these moments.

item.title: Falling Forward
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Our “Taking Ground” series continues as Pastor Doug shares from Joshua 8. In this message, we see Joshua and the Israelites learn from their previous failure at Ai and listen to the Lord on their way to a sweeping victory. We also see them renew their covenant with God as we discover why failure is such a good teacher and how it demonstrates our need to be fully dependent upon God.

item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Chris Baselice explains what the Bible tells us about second chances. Discover how to break free from self-inflicted suffering and how to walk the road of recovery and redemption.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug shares from Joshua 9 as we explore the deception of the Gibeonites and how we can ensure we find ourselves in the truth, why we shouldn’t be so hasty to make oaths or promises, and the importance of keeping our word.

item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Greg Anderson
item.itunes:summary: Making decisions is a key part of daily life. We all know this. But do you have a strategy for how you make decision? In this message, Community Life Pastor Greg Anderson explores the importance of wisdom and discernment in our spiritual life.

item.title: Keep Fighting For Ground
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our “Taking Ground” study, Pastor Chris Baselice from our Plantation campus shares a powerful word from Joshua 10. In this message, we see a wild and miraculous scene as God made the sun stand still in order to help the Israelites take ground. We also learn why the devil will often attack us by going after the people we love.

item.title: Misunderstood
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our “Taking Ground” series, Pastor Duane Roberts from our Boynton Beach campus explores Joshua 22, exposing a big misunderstanding that took place between the tribes of Israel. In this message, we discover how unity within the body of Christ brings about blessings, how much chaos and division can be caused by misunderstanding, and the dangers of rushing to judgment.

item.title: Passing the Baton
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our “Taking Ground” study, Pastor Doug explores Joshua 23, where we see Joshua deliver his farewell address to the people of Israel. In this message, we discover the importance of investing in and discipling the next generation, and the dangers of dropping the baton like Joshua did by failing to train up a successor—as Moses did with him.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Concluding our series through the Book of Joshua, Pastor Doug shares from Joshua 24. In this message, we explore the second part of Joshua’s farewell address to the people of Israel, discover what it means to be a covenant people, and learn how to be witnesses to all that God has done and is doing in, through, and around us.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, we'll discover what our response to the love of God through Christ should be as Pastor Doug explains the importance of trust and obedience in our relationship with Jesus, how love reveals who we truly are, how our love for God and others grows in the family of faith, and how to fight for real love.

item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message 12/2/2018
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What is love? It’s a question humans have pondered since the beginning of time. Sadly, what the world tries to sell as love is anything but love. So how can we know? Where does the answer truly lie? Continuing our “Love On” study, Pastor Doug shares from 1 John 4. In this message, we discover what the power of perfect love is, how we can experience the fullness of it, and how we can share it with others.

item.title: Love Wins
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message 12/9/2018
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What if you got a guarantee about how life turns out in the end? What if you could know that your story will have a happy ending, that you’d win when it’s all said and done? How would you live your life differently? In this final message from the "Love On" series, Pastor Doug teaches from 1 John 5 as we explore what we have when we have Jesus in our heart and discover the amazing and wonderful ending that allows us to live with freedom and courage today.

item.title: OneHope Story
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Bob Hoskins
item.itunes:summary: In our kick-off of Missions Week, special guest Bob Hoskins, founder of One Hope, shares about the power of missions work and how God can use you to make a difference in the lives of people here and around the world.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Gary Haugen, founder and president of International Justice Mission, join us for an exploration of God’s passion for justice and the world, how God reveals His goodness to the world, and how He wants to use us to impact lives.

item.title: The Worst Day
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week one of "Why?: A Study Through Job," Pastor Joel Sonnenberg from our King’s Kids Ministry joins Pastor Doug to discuss why suffering exists and how to respond to suffering.

item.title: What Now?
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: David Guzik
item.itunes:summary: In week two of our study through Job, Pastor David Guzik, renowned Bible teacher, author, and creator of some of the most widely used Bible commentaries, joins us as we dive into Job 2 and 3. In this message, we see Job deal with the question “Where do I go from here?”. Discover how to deal with pain, suffering, loss, grief, and how to wrestle with why in a healthy, biblical way.

item.title: If God Brought You To It He Will Get You Through It
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Joel Sonnenberg
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Joel Sonnenberg continues the discussion about suffering and the themes of Job 1. Get a more in-depth analysis and hear Pastor Joel’s powerful testimony.

item.title: Walking In The Dark With God
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever questioned God? So often, when life doesn’t make sense, the why questions start creeping into our minds. In week three of our study, Pastor Doug explores the wrestle of faith in seasons of suffering, why God’s silence does not equal God’s absence, and why it’s so important to build up our faith before the storms of suffering come.

item.title: God Speaks
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week four of our study through Job, Pastor Doug teaches from Job 38–41. In this message, we explore the moment God breaks His silence and speaks to Job out of a huge storm and get an amazing view of the character, sovereignty, and wisdom of God.

item.title: When Good Friends Give Bad Advice
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug explores the intense back-and-forth exchange between Job and his friends as we find out how Job reacts to his well-intentioned, yet misguided friends, and how we can navigate the stupid things people say sometimes.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: As we wrap up the "Why" series, Pastor Doug explores Job 42, showing how Job’s story ends and how it connects to our lives today and beyond.
