item.title: Vision Weekend 2019: A Gospel Movement
item.itunes:subtitle: 2Corinthians 5:20
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary:
A year ago, we cast a vision: to double the number of disciples in our region by the year 2023. You see, we believe that God is moving in South Florida, and we want to join Him in that amazing movement.

In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder shares what the Lord has done over the last year, and reminds us all of the "why" of Vision 2023, what the mission is, and how we can all get in the story and be part of something bigger than any one person or campus.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder

item.itunes:subtitle: 2Corinthians 5:20
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this second of two special vision weekends, Pastor Doug Sauder shares what it means to go all in, why it’s important that each of us go after “the one,” and how we can all get in the story and be part of this amazing gospel movement that’s taking place in our region.

item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, we examine how we speak to God and others. Learn how to talk to God, speak truth into your own life, resolve conflict, and engage in both the life-giving and difficult conversations in life.

item.title: The Beginning
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Genesis is a book of firsts. The origins of the universe, the earth, life, marriage, family, nations, laws, languages. The first few chapters orient us to everything we see in life. Why is that important? Because in our origins we find the answers to life's big questions . . . Who am I? Why am I here? What's the meaning of life? In this first message of our "Origins" series, Pastor Doug shares the story of creation from Genesis 1:1–25, showing us some powerful, beautiful characteristics of God while unpacking everything leading up to the creation of humanity.

item.title: Creation/Evolution
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, a panel of experts and Calvary church leaders discuss one of the most hotly debated issues in the church over the last century: creation vs. evolution. Hear what the Bible has to say about the foundations of the universe and the evidences to support it.

item.title: This Is What You Were Made For
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In week two of our "Origins" series, Pastor Chris Baselice of our Plantation campus teaches from Genesis 1:26–2:3. In this message, we explore the creation of mankind, what it means to be bearers of God’s image and likeness, the original intent and purpose for mankind, and how we can get back that original design . . . how we can get back to Eden.

item.title: The Perfect Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: We all long for perfection. We dream of taking the perfect vacation, eating the perfect dish, landing the perfect job, having the perfect wedding, and enjoying the perfect family . . . But is perfection possible? Can we have the perfect life? In week three of our “Origins: the Beginning” series, Pastor Duane Roberts of our Boynton Beach campus shares a powerful word from Genesis 2:4–25. In this message, we explore God’s perfect desires for us, the creation of Eve, and the role of humanity as caretaker of the earth.

item.title: Trouble In Paradise
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug explores the worst moment in human history . . . the fall of man in the Garden of Eden, examining the twisted temptation of the serpent, the first sin, the cover up and consequences, and the promise of God that set His plan of redemption in motion.
item.description: In this message, Pastor Doug explores the worst moment in human history . . . the fall of man in the Garden of Eden, examining the twisted temptation of the serpent, the first sin, the cover up and consequences, and the promise of God that set His plan of redemption in motion.

item.title: The Complimentary Roles Of Men And Women
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing the themes of Genesis 3, in this message Pastor Doug examines one of the biggest hot-button topics in the Church today: gender roles in the Church and the world. Find out what we believe the Bible tells us regarding the roles of men and women and how they complement one another.

item.title: The First Family
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, we explore what went wrong between Cain and Abel, how jealousy and isolation poison your soul and lead to bitterness and regret, and we learn what happens when our understanding of stewardship and worship are out of whack.

item.title: A Walk Home
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Stephan Tchividjian
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Stephan Tchividjian breaks down the generations from Adam to Noah, reveals six reasons why we should walk with God, and shares how we can with Him.

item.title: He Is Still A Good God
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Steve Mayo
item.itunes:summary: Good and evil . . . How can we tell the difference, especially when it’s not so obvious? Why does evil exist if God is good? Did He create evil? In this message, Steve Mayo, the Calvary Christian Academy Director of Discipleship, addresses this profound, age-old topic.

item.title: The Ark
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message from Genesis 6, Pastor Doug introduces us to Noah, a righteous man in an exceedingly wicked generation. Follow along with us as we examine what made Noah righteous, and how evil corrupts and sin spreads in our world.

item.title: Hoping To Get Caught Up In The Hype
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Chris Baselice from our Plantation campus addressed an extremely important and relevant topic: the rapture of the Church. Discover what the Bible says about Jesus coming back for His Church and what we should be doing in the meantime.

item.title: The Flood
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message on Genesis 7, Pastor Doug examines the overwhelming evidence for the historicity of the Flood, invites us to put ourselves in the shoes of Noah and his family as they boarded the ark, rode out the storm, and stayed in the ark for 371 days, and shows us how Jesus has come to save us from the coming wrath and second judgment.

item.title: In The Beginning Was The Gospel
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Bill Schott
item.itunes:summary: As we continue our midweek examination of the topics covered in Genesis, hear from Pastor Bill Schott, head of the CCA Bible department, about how the gospel of Jesus is woven so intricately throughout the Old Testament. In this message, we'll learn how we can see the typology of Jesus in the story of the Flood.

item.title: The Promise
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing the story of the Flood, Pastor Doug takes us through Genesis 8. In this message, we'll see Noah and his family exit the ark. We'll also see the establishment of the very first covenant as God makes a promise to mankind.

item.title: God Has A Plan For You…Yes You!
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:summary: As we continue our study through the first part of Genesis, Pastor Jerry Sander of our Boca campus shares what happened when Noah and his family exited the ark in Genesis 9. In this message, we'll explore the blessing and directive God placed on Noah, the promise of the rainbow, and Noah’s bad day.

item.title: What’s Your Drug Of Choice?
item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In this message, we continue our discussion of the themes from Genesis 9 as Pastor Chris Baselice from our Plantation campus gives us an in-depth look at drugs and alcohol addiction and recovery.

item.title: Building Altars, Not Towers
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: As we conclude this amazing journey through the first part of Genesis Pastor Doug shares where we all come from as we explore the Table of Nations, the Tower of Babel, how we’re all descended from one of Noah’s sons, and how humanity spread throughout the world.

item.itunes:summary: In week one of our discipleship class series, Pastor Doug explores what it truly means to be a disciple of Jesus Christ.

item.itunes:author: Daniel Hickling
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our midweek Discipleship class series, Pastor Dan Hickling shares helpful and practical ways to study the Bible. Learn how to take your devotional life to the next level.

item.itunes:subtitle: Midweek Message
item.itunes:author: Reuben Ramsaran
item.itunes:summary: In week five of our midweek discipleship class series, we hear from Pastor Reuben Ramsaran of our Fort Lauderdale campus on what it truly means to experience redemption in the broken areas of your life through the power and love of Christ.

item.title: Heaven Is a Place
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever wondered what heaven will be like? Do you have any questions about where we go when we die? Are you looking for a richer understanding of who God is? In week one of our heaven series, Pastor Doug Sauder explains the reality of heaven, dispels the misconceptions and lies Satan has sold us about the afterlife, and shares how having an eternal mindset can change your life today.
item.description: Have you ever wondered what heaven will be like? Do you have any questions about where we go when we die? Are you looking for a richer understanding of who God is? In week one of our heaven series, Pastor Doug Sauder explains the reality of heaven, dispels the misconceptions and lies Satan has sold us about the afterlife, and shares how having an eternal mindset can change your life today.

item.title: Heaven Is A Place For You
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: The statistics show 10 out of 10 people will die. And when it comes, where will you go? In part two of our series on heaven, Pastor Chris Baselice explains why heaven is not our default destination, how what we believe determines where we go, and how we can know for sure we’re going to heaven.

item.title: Imagine Heaven
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What will we be like in heaven? Who will we be? How will we look? What will we do? Will we know people? In part three of our series, Pastor Doug invites us to imagine heaven, to gain a deeper understanding of what awaits us in eternity.
item.description: What will we be like in heaven? Who will we be? How will we look? What will we do? Will we know people? In part three of our series, Pastor Doug invites us to imagine heaven, to gain a deeper understanding of what awaits us in eternity.

item.title: Heaven Meets Earth
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What is the geography of heaven? How big is it? What will happen to the earth? In this message, we'll wrap up our “Heaven” series as Pastor Doug examines the blueprint of heaven, its center, the new Jerusalem and the new earth, and what our greatest joy in heaven will be.

item.title: The End
item.itunes:subtitle: Good Friday 2018
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this special Good Friday message, we'll go back in time to examine Good Friday from perspective of Matthew, one of the Jesus' disciples. Follow along as Pastor Doug shares Matthew's account of the crucifixion in vivid detail, and remember how Jesus Christ took our place, bore our punishment, and died on our behalf.

item.title: Begin Again
item.itunes:subtitle: Easter Sunday 2018
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this special Easter message, celebrate with us as Pastor Doug shares how the resurrection of Jesus can change our lives and give us hope for a new future.
item.description: In this special Easter message, celebrate with us as Pastor Doug shares how the resurrection of Jesus can change our lives and give us hope for a new future.

item.title: Who Do You Want To Be?
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In part one of our Sermon on the Mount series, Pastor Doug gives us a synopsis of the Beatitudes, explaining the presence of the Kingdom of God on earth and the power of the promises of God.
item.description: In part one of our Sermon on the Mount series, Pastor Doug gives us a synopsis of the Beatitudes, explaining the presence of the Kingdom of God on earth and the power of the promises of God.

item.title: Unfamiliar Passions of God
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Gary Haugen
item.itunes:summary: "Are Jesus and I really interested in the same things?" This is a powerful and important question we must all ask ourselves. In this message, special guest Gary Haugen, founder and president of International Justice Mission, explores God’s passion for justice and the world, how God reveals His goodness to the world, and how He wants to use us to impact lives.
item.description: "Are Jesus and I really interested in the same things?" This is a powerful and important question we must all ask ourselves. In this message, special guest Gary Haugen, founder and president of International Justice Mission, explores God’s passion for justice and the world, how God reveals His goodness to the world, and how He wants to use us to impact lives.

item.title: Hungry For God
item.itunes:subtitle: Weekend Message
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What are you hungry for? In this message, we'll discover what it means to hunger and thirst for righteousness and be filled, the value of mercy over judgment, and how we can accept Jesus’ invitation to see God.
item.description: What are you hungry for? In this message, we'll discover what it means to hunger and thirst for righteousness and be filled, the value of mercy over judgment, and how we can accept Jesus’ invitation to see God.

item.title: Waging Peace
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In part four of our study through the Sermon on the Mount, we explore Matthew 5:9–12. In this message, Pastor Doug we discover what it means to be a peacemaker, how conflict should be resolved, and receive encouragement regarding the impermanence of persecution.
item.description: In part four of our study through the Sermon on the Mount, we explore Matthew 5:9–12. In this message, Pastor Doug we discover what it means to be a peacemaker, how conflict should be resolved, and receive encouragement regarding the impermanence of persecution.

item.title: The Law of The Kingdom
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our study through the Sermon on the Mount, Pastor Doug shares from Matthew 5:17–26. In this message, we explore purpose of God’s law, how Jesus came to give the law its full meaning, and what the law of the kingdom means for our lives.
item.description: Continuing our study through the Sermon on the Mount, Pastor Doug shares from Matthew 5:17–26. In this message, we explore purpose of God’s law, how Jesus came to give the law its full meaning, and what the law of the kingdom means for our lives.

item.title: Keeping Vows
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug explores why honoring our vows honors the Lord, how love keeps its promises, and why lust is a counterfeit, a knock-off of something much better and truly fulfilling.
item.description: In this message, Pastor Doug explores why honoring our vows honors the Lord, how love keeps its promises, and why lust is a counterfeit, a knock-off of something much better and truly fulfilling.

item.title: Living Like Sons for an Audience of One
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Chris Baselice of our Plantation campus shares the true meaning of “an eye for an eye” and why we should turn the other cheek, the kind of love we should have for our enemies, and the importance of giving, praying, and fasting in the life of the believer.
item.description: In this message, Pastor Chris Baselice of our Plantation campus shares the true meaning of “an eye for an eye” and why we should turn the other cheek, the kind of love we should have for our enemies, and the importance of giving, praying, and fasting in the life of the believer.

item.title: The Good Life
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Are you living the good life? The kind of life that, when you put your head on your pillow at night, makes you feel content, at peace with yourself, others, and God. So, what does that life look like? What does it mean to experience the good life, and what do you have to do to attain it? That's what the Sermon on the Mount reveals to us! In this Palm Sunday message, Pastor Doug shares with us what the good life is all about as we study Matthew 6:19–34.

item.title: Built To Last
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Wrapping our our series of the Sermon on the Mount with an in-depth look at Matthew 7:1–29, Pastor Doug explains how to build a rooted, blossoming, lasting life of faith.
item.description: Wrapping our our series of the Sermon on the Mount with an in-depth look at Matthew 7:1–29, Pastor Doug explains how to build a rooted, blossoming, lasting life of faith.

item.title: What do you bring to the table
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder shares from the Book of Philippians chapter one. Here we find Paul writing to the church in Phillippi from a jail cell, but despite his circumstances he is filled with joy having witnessed a woman, a slave, and a gentile united around the gospel. Therefore, be encouraged that regardless of your race, income, gender, or title, we labor together under one banner, Jesus Christ.

item.title: Its Not About You
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this week’s message, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches on the importance of living in community with others and for others. Rather than asking, “What do I want to do with my life?” we’re taught we should look beyond our own desires toward what God has waiting for us and our communities.
item.description: In this week’s message, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches on the importance of living in community with others and for others. Rather than asking, “What do I want to do with my life?” we’re taught we should look beyond our own desires toward what God has waiting for us and our communities.

item.title: Climb Down the Ladder
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Did you know that you fight a daily battle in your mind? And the enemy is formidable. It’s an issue that every person faces, an issue that wages war within us: pride. But how do you defeat this enemy? This weekend we continue our “Better Together” series as Pastor Doug shares from Philippians 2:1–11, explaining that pride can only be vanquished when we surrender up our rights and put others first, when we climb down the ladder and humbly serve others.

item.title: The Joy Of Response
item.itunes:author: Nate Holdridge
item.itunes:summary: Guest speaker Pastor Nate Holdridge of Calvary Chapel Monterey shares from Philippians chapter two. Here we find Paul exhorting us to "work out our salvation" with the promise that God's command is also the assurance of His enabling. When we submit to God, He empowers us to do His will.

item.title: All The Rules Have Changed And So Has The Game
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Doug Sauder kicks off week four of “Better Together” in Philippians 3:1-14. We are reminded that confidence in our flesh does not lead to righteousness. Instead, we must remain confident and boastful only in knowing the Lord, knowing that confidence and righteousness are the results of abundant relationship with Him—not religion.

item.title: Citizens of Heaven
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What does it mean to be a citizen of Heaven, and how does that impact your life on the earth? Continuing our “Better Together” series, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches us that citizens of Heaven have the responsibility to influence their world, give earthly politics their proper weight, give up their rights for the gospel, and know that the best is yet to come!
item.description: What does it mean to be a citizen of Heaven, and how does that impact your life on the earth? item.title: Peace of Mind
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: How can we find peace of mind in the middle of chaos? Life is full of things that can rob our joy, but there is only one way to have true peace: Jesus! Continuing our “Better Together” series through the Book of Philippians, Pastor Doug Sauder lays out seven spiritual disciplines that, if put into practice, will help us grow closer to Christ as we reflect His character and experience genuine peace of mind.
item.description: How can we find peace of mind in the middle of chaos? Life is full of things that can rob our joy, but there is only one way to have true peace: Jesus! Continuing our “Better Together” series through the Book of Philippians, Pastor Doug Sauder lays out seven spiritual disciplines that, if put into practice, will help us grow closer to Christ as we reflect His character and experience genuine peace of mind.

item.title: The Generous Church
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: The church of Philippi had a distinctive reputation for its heart of generosity. Paul writes to the church, “I am full, having received from . . . you, a sweet-smelling aroma, an acceptable sacrifice, well pleasing to God” (Philippians 4:18 NKJV). As we act as generous vessels, God meets our needs for He loves a cheerful giver.

item.title: You Are Worth It
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our examination of the basic elements of Christianity, Pastor Jerry Sander taught from 1 Thessalonians 2. Through this teaching, we learn that as children of God we are not only welcomed into His family, but we are also worthy witnesses of His grace.

item.content:encoded: Continuing our examination of the basic elements of Christianity, Pastor Jerry Sander taught from 1 Thessalonians 2. Through this teaching, we learn that as children of God we are not only welcomed into His family, but we are also worthy witnesses of His grace.

item.title: More Than Words
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off our study through 1 Thessalonians, Paul's first letter, Pastor Doug shared how, above all else, the most important identifier we have is that we are children of God in Christ. As we center ourselves upon this identity, we will be motivated to honor the Lord with our lives, use our words to speak life into the lives of others, and ultimately be used by the Spirit to leave a deep impression on people.
item.description: Kicking off our study through 1 Thessalonians, Paul's first letter, Pastor Doug shared how, above all else, the most important identifier we have is that we are children of God in Christ. As we center ourselves upon this identity, we will be motivated to honor the Lord with our lives, use our words to speak life into the lives of others, and ultimately be used by the Spirit to leave a deep impression on people.

As we center ourselves upon this identity, we will be motivated to honor the Lord with our lives, use our words to speak life into the lives of others, and ultimately be used by the Spirit to leave a deep impression on people.

item.title: Sonship
item.itunes:author: Alan Platt
item.itunes:summary: As we continue our study through 1 Thessalonians, Pastor Alan Platt teaches us that it is through our identity in Christ that we are inheritors of His maturity and authority. We learn that in spite of trials and tribulations, our faith and love for one another must remain evident.
item.description: As we continue our study through 1 Thessalonians, Pastor Alan Platt teaches us that it is through our identity in Christ that we are inheritors of His maturity and authority. We learn that in spite of trials and tribulations, our faith and love for one another must remain evident.

We learn that in spite of trials and tribulations, our faith and love for one another must remain evident.

item.title: The Next Level
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: There are a lot of things in life that promise to take us to the next level: higher education, job opportunities, fitness programs, relationships. But this weekend, as we continued making our way through 1 Thessalonians, Pastor Duane Roberts from our Boynton campus explained that it's only through the love of God that we can reach the next level of life!
item.description: There are a lot of things in life that promise to take us to the next level: higher education, job opportunities, fitness programs, relationships. But this weekend, as we continued making our way through 1 Thessalonians, Pastor Duane Roberts from our Boynton campus explained that it's only through the love of God that we can reach the next level of life!

But this weekend, as we continued making our way through 1 Thessalonians, Pastor Duane Roberts from our Boynton campus explained that it's only through the love of God that we can reach the next level of life!

item.title: The Return
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: From television and movies to popular novels, it seems people are becoming increasingly infatuated with the apocalypse, the end times. For many (even Christians), this brings about feelings of fear and anxiety. But this weekend, as we continued to work our way through 1 Thessalonians, Pastor Doug showed us why the end times—when Jesus returns for His Church—shouldn't make us fearful, but hopeful and excited!
item.description: From television and movies to popular novels, it seems people are becoming increasingly infatuated with the apocalypse, the end times. For many (even Christians), this brings about feelings of fear and anxiety. But this weekend, as we continued to work our way through 1 Thessalonians, Pastor Doug showed us why the end times—when Jesus returns for His Church—shouldn't make us fearful, but hopeful and excited!

But this weekend, as we continued to work our way through 1 Thessalonians, Pastor Doug showed us why the end times—when Jesus returns for His Church—shouldn't make us fearful, but hopeful and excited!

item.title: Self Test
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message pastor Doug Sauder wraps up our study in 1 Thessalonians as we look at Paul's final exhortations to the church. Here Paul encourages God's people to be aware of seven principles that mark the life of a believer: rejoice, pray, give thanks, be at peace, examine yourself closely, don't quench the spirit of God, and cultivate a love for truth.
item.description: In this message pastor Doug Sauder wraps up our study in 1 Thessalonians as we look at Paul's final exhortations to the church. Here Paul encourages God's people to be aware of seven principles that mark the life of a believer: rejoice, pray, give thanks, be at peace, examine yourself closely, don't quench the spirit of God, and cultivate a love for truth.

Here Paul encourages God's people to be aware of seven principles that mark the life of a believer: rejoice, pray, give thanks, be at peace, examine yourself closely, don't quench the spirit of God, and cultivate a love for truth.

item.title: Last Letter
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this first teaching of our study through the Book of 2 Timothy–the last letter from the apostle Paul–Pastor Doug Sauder shares with us the wisdom that comes from this key biblical figure and how it relates to us today.
item.description: In this first teaching of our study through the Book of 2 Timothy–the last letter from the apostle Paul–Pastor Doug Sauder shares with us the wisdom that comes from this key biblical figure and how it relates to us today.
item.content:encoded: In this first teaching of our study through the Book of 2 Timothy–the last letter from the apostle Paul–Pastor Doug Sauder shares with us the wisdom that comes from this key biblical figure and how it relates to us today.

item.title: Be Strong
item.itunes:author: Billy Venezia Jr.
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Billy paints a picture of the apostle Paul writing to Timothy from his prison cell. Paul's message in chapter 2 was for Timothy to be strong in grace. To accomplish this, it takes the focus of a soldier in war, the discipline of an athlete in competition, and the patience of a farmer with his crops.
item.description: Pastor Billy paints a picture of the apostle Paul writing to Timothy from his prison cell. Paul's message in chapter 2 was for Timothy to be strong in grace. To accomplish this, it takes the focus of a soldier in war, the discipline of an athlete in competition, and the patience of a farmer with his crops.

To accomplish this, it takes the focus of a soldier in war, the discipline of an athlete in competition, and the patience of a farmer with his crops.

item.title: The Ministry of The Word
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Continuing through our study of 2 Timothy, Pastor Chris Baselice of our Plantation campus teaches on the second chapter—the apostle Paul's last letter to Timothy. In this message we are challenged to be dividers of the Word, doers of the Word, and defenders of the Word.
item.description: Continuing through our study of 2 Timothy, Pastor Chris Baselice of our Plantation campus teaches on the second chapter—the apostle Paul's last letter to Timothy. In this message we are challenged to be dividers of the Word, doers of the Word, and defenders of the Word.

item.title: Rough Days Up Ahead
item.itunes:summary: The apostle Paul warns Timothy that in the last days, perilous times will come. Although this is true for all of us, no matter where we are in life, Pastor Fidel Gomez reminds us to keep our eyes on Jesus, because whatever "peril" we may face the greater truth is that this is not the end.
item.description: The apostle Paul warns Timothy that in the last days, perilous times will come. Although this is true for all of us, no matter where we are in life, Pastor Fidel Gomez reminds us to keep our eyes on Jesus, because whatever "peril" we may face the greater truth is that this is not the end.

Although this is true for all of us, no matter where we are in life, Pastor Fidel Gomez reminds us to keep our eyes on Jesus, because whatever "peril" we may face the greater truth is that this is not the end.

item.title: Roadmap to Righteousness
item.itunes:summary: As we continue our study of 2 Timothy, Pastor Jerry Sander of our Boca Raton campus explores Paul's words to young Timothy. Here we are encouraged to not be deceived, discouraged, or distracted, but rather to remain focused on the basics of our faith, allowing God's inspired Word to train us into Christian men and women others can follow.
item.description: As we continue our study of 2 Timothy, Pastor Jerry Sander of our Boca Raton campus explores Paul's words to young Timothy. Here we are encouraged to not be deceived, discouraged, or distracted, but rather to remain focused on the basics of our faith, allowing God's inspired Word to train us into Christian men and women others can follow.

Here we are encouraged to not be deceived, discouraged, or distracted, but rather to remain focused on the basics of our faith, allowing God's inspired Word to train us into Christian men and women others can follow.

item.title: Fulfill Your Ministry
item.itunes:author: Joey Ferraro
item.itunes:summary: As we continue through our teaching of 2 Timothy, Pastor Joe Ferraro from our West Boca campus examines the apostle Paul's exhortation to Timothy to focus his efforts on fulfilling the ministry that God has brought before him and to be faithful to what has been entrusted to him–and to us.
item.description: As we continue through our teaching of 2 Timothy, Pastor Joe Ferraro from our West Boca campus examines the apostle Paul's exhortation to Timothy to focus his efforts on fulfilling the ministry that God has brought before him and to be faithful to what has been entrusted to him–and to us.

item.title: He is Enough!
item.itunes:author: Duane Roberts
item.itunes:summary: Finishing our series in the book of 2 Timothy, Pastor Duane Roberts reminds us that no matter what trial is going on in our lives, we can trust that God is always enough.
item.description: Finishing our series in the book of 2 Timothy, Pastor Duane Roberts reminds us that no matter what trial is going on in our lives, we can trust that God is always enough.
item.content:encoded: Finishing our series in the book of 2 Timothy, Pastor Duane Roberts reminds us that no matter what trial is going on in our lives, we can trust that God is always enough.

item.title: Introduction to 1 Timothy
item.itunes:author: Joe Focht
item.itunes:summary: Guest speaker Joe Focht from Calvary Chapel Philadelphia starts off our study in 1 Timothy. Through this teaching, we learn how Paul's exhortation to Timothy to live for Christ in a culture on decline is as relevant today as it was when it was written.
item.description: Guest speaker Joe Focht from Calvary Chapel Philadelphia starts off our study in 1 Timothy. Through this teaching, we learn how Paul's exhortation to Timothy to live for Christ in a culture on decline is as relevant today as it was when it was written.
item.content:encoded: Guest speaker Joe Focht from Calvary Chapel Philadelphia starts off our study in 1 Timothy. Through this teaching, we learn how Paul's exhortation to Timothy to live for Christ in a culture on decline is as relevant today as it was when it was written.

item.title: The Glorious Grace of God
item.itunes:author: Andrew Lundy
item.itunes:summary: How far does the grace of the Lord extend? Continuing our midweek “Build” study through 1 Timothy, youth leader Andrew Lundy shares how God's grace makes ministry out of a mess, creates an exhibit of God's mercy out of flawed humanity, produces Christ-centered glory in a self-centered world, and provides the sufficiency of strength for the deficiency of faith.
item.description: How far does the grace of the Lord extend? Continuing our midweek “Build” study through 1 Timothy, youth leader Andrew Lundy shares how God's grace makes ministry out of a mess, creates an exhibit of God's mercy out of flawed humanity, produces Christ-centered glory in a self-centered world, and provides the sufficiency of strength for the deficiency of faith.
item.content:encoded: How far does the grace of the Lord extend? Continuing our midweek “Build” study through 1 Timothy, youth leader Andrew Lundy shares how God's grace makes ministry out of a mess, creates an exhibit of God's mercy out of flawed humanity, produces Christ-centered glory in a self-centered world, and provides the sufficiency of strength for the deficiency of faith.

item.title: House Rules
item.itunes:author: Billy Venezia Jr.
item.itunes:summary: Are there any rules in your house? Maybe it's to turn the lights off when you leave the room or never go to bed angry. Continuing our midweek “Build” study through 1 Timothy, Pastor Billy Venezia shares the apostle Paul's concern for the church at Ephesus as he lays down clear rules for how the church ought to pray and worship and outlines the specific, God-ordained roles for men in women in the church.
item.description: Are there any rules in your house? Maybe it's to turn the lights off when you leave the room or never go to bed angry. Continuing our midweek “Build” study through 1 Timothy, Pastor Billy Venezia shares the apostle Paul's concern for the church at Ephesus as he lays down clear rules for how the church ought to pray and worship and outlines the specific, God-ordained roles for men in women in the church.

item.title: Ingredients For Spiritual Maturity
item.itunes:summary: The apostle Paul planted a church in Ephesus that was later turned over to his young protégé Timothy. As Pastor Fidel Gomez continues our series through 1 Timothy, we see Paul outline how the church should function and describes the qualities Timothy needs to look for in the men who will help him lead the church.

As Pastor Fidel Gomez continues our series through 1 Timothy, we see Paul outline how the church should function and describes the qualities Timothy needs to look for in the men who will help him lead the church.

item.title: Servanthood That Transcends Age
item.itunes:author: Steve Mayo
item.itunes:summary: In this installment of our study through the Book of 1 Timothy, Pastor Steve Mayo takes an in-depth look at chapter 4 and what it takes to be a devoted servant of Jesus Christ.
item.description: In this installment of our study through the Book of 1 Timothy, Pastor Steve Mayo takes an in-depth look at chapter 4 and what it takes to be a devoted servant of Jesus Christ.
item.content:encoded: In this installment of our study through the Book of 1 Timothy, Pastor Steve Mayo takes an in-depth look at chapter 4 and what it takes to be a devoted servant of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Rules of Engagement
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Newsflash: the Church is made up of imperfect people! As a young pastor, Timothy faced many challenges overseeing an imperfect family of believers. Seeing this, Paul gives wise advice and specific guidelines about how to love and lead men and women of all ages and position into right and holy relationships.

Seeing this, Paul gives wise advice and specific guidelines about how to love and lead men and women of all ages and position into right and holy relationships.

item.title: Live with _____ for the gospels sake
item.itunes:author: Josiah Graves
item.itunes:summary: What is the most radical way you could live your life for the gospel? Sometimes it's not seen in the most extreme ways but in the every day. Paul continues his letter to Timothy sharing practical examples of ways the church could be a witness of Christ to those around them by living their lives with honor, humility, and contentment.
item.description: What is the most radical way you could live your life for the gospel? Sometimes it's not seen in the most extreme ways but in the every day. Paul continues his letter to Timothy sharing practical examples of ways the church could be a witness of Christ to those around them by living their lives with honor, humility, and contentment.

Paul continues his letter to Timothy sharing practical examples of ways the church could be a witness of Christ to those around them by living their lives with honor, humility, and contentment.

item.title: Stay The Course
item.itunes:summary: As Pastor Jerry Sander concludes our series in the Book of 1 Timothy, he breaks down the Christian life—a life that's personal, powerful, and perilous but also one of pursuit, patience, and potential pitfalls. Through this message, we're encouraged to “stay the course” that God has prepared for us.
item.description: As Pastor Jerry Sander concludes our series in the Book of 1 Timothy, he breaks down the Christian life—a life that's personal, powerful, and perilous but also one of pursuit, patience, and potential pitfalls. Through this message, we're encouraged to “stay the course” that God has prepared for us.

Through this message, we're encouraged to “stay the course” that God has prepared for us.

item.title: The Burden
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Usually our first instinct when something arises is to take action, but God would have us response differently. This weekend, we kicked off our “Build” study with a message from Nehemiah 1 as Pastor Doug shared that when God places a burden on our hearts, we need to take time to process it with prayer and fasting instead of acting impulsively.
item.description: Usually our first instinct when something arises is to take action, but God would have us response differently. This weekend, we kicked off our “Build” study with a message from Nehemiah 1 as Pastor Doug shared that when God places a burden on our hearts, we need to take time to process it with prayer and fasting instead of acting impulsively.
item.content:encoded: Usually our first instinct when something arises is to take action, but God would have us response differently. This weekend, we kicked off our “Build” study with a message from Nehemiah 1 as Pastor Doug shared that when God places a burden on our hearts, we need to take time to process it with prayer and fasting instead of acting impulsively.

item.title: Building Nehemiah
item.itunes:author: Billy Venezia Jr.
item.itunes:summary: It's hard when you find yourself in God's waiting room, but it's here that He builds your character. This is what God did for Nehemiah, a man of patience and prayer. Nehemiah understood that God needed to build the walls of his heart before he could rebuild the walls of Jerusalem. In this message, Pastor Billy Venezia challenges us to consider prayer and patience as building blocks in the shaping of our character.
item.description: It's hard when you find yourself in God's waiting room, but it's here that He builds your character. This is what God did for Nehemiah, a man of patience and prayer. Nehemiah understood that God needed to build the walls of his heart before he could rebuild the walls of Jerusalem. In this message, Pastor Billy Venezia challenges us to consider prayer and patience as building blocks in the shaping of our character.

item.title: An Overview of Ezra
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: As Pastor Chris Baselice gives us an overview of the Book of Ezra, we learn that while the people build the temple, God is building the people.
item.description: As Pastor Chris Baselice gives us an overview of the Book of Ezra, we learn that while the people build the temple, God is building the people.
item.content:encoded: As Pastor Chris Baselice gives us an overview of the Book of Ezra, we learn that while the people build the temple, God is building the people.

item.title: Casting Vision
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: As Pastor Doug Sauder continues through the Book of Nehemiah in our “Build” series, we learn that God pours vision into His servants. When God is doing a deep work in your life, He leads you into a difficult, desert environment to fully form the vision He's placed in your heart.
item.description: As Pastor Doug Sauder continues through the Book of Nehemiah in our “Build” series, we learn that God pours vision into His servants. When God is doing a deep work in your life, He leads you into a difficult, desert environment to fully form the vision He's placed in your heart.

When God is doing a deep work in your life, He leads you into a difficult, desert environment to fully form the vision He's placed in your heart.

item.title: Get Ready to Rumble in the Rubble
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Whenever God's people rise up to build, the enemy rises up to destroy. Continuing the study through the Book of Nehemiah in our “Build” series, Pastor Chris Baselice challenges us to expect the attack of the enemy and be ready to fight for our families as we continue the work.
item.description: Whenever God's people rise up to build, the enemy rises up to destroy. Continuing the study through the Book of Nehemiah in our “Build” series, Pastor Chris Baselice challenges us to expect the attack of the enemy and be ready to fight for our families as we continue the work.
item.content:encoded: Whenever God's people rise up to build, the enemy rises up to destroy. Continuing the study through the Book of Nehemiah in our “Build” series, Pastor Chris Baselice challenges us to expect the attack of the enemy and be ready to fight for our families as we continue the work.

item.title: Injustice Is Unjust
item.itunes:summary: In the fifth chapter of Nehemiah, we see God's people facing injustice. As we study Nehemiah's Christ-like reaction, we learn how to pause and pray instead of letting our anger drive us to hasty action, and we discover how to properly take a stand for justice knowing that our God responds, redeems, and remembers.
item.description: In the fifth chapter of Nehemiah, we see God's people facing injustice. As we study Nehemiah's Christ-like reaction, we learn how to pause and pray instead of letting our anger drive us to hasty action, and we discover how to properly take a stand for justice knowing that our God responds, redeems, and remembers.

As we study Nehemiah's Christ-like reaction, we learn how to pause and pray instead of letting our anger drive us to hasty action, and we discover how to properly take a stand for justice knowing that our God responds, redeems, and remembers.

item.title: Fighting Fear
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Has fear ever crippled you from completing what God has called you to do? You're not alone! This weekend, Pastor Doug Sauder shared from Nehemiah 6–7, taking us through the attacks toward Nehemiah as he closed in on the completion of the wall. See Nehemiah's resolve to continue the work God had for him and be inspired to stand firm against the enemies in your life.
item.description: Has fear ever crippled you from completing what God has called you to do? You're not alone! This weekend, Pastor Doug Sauder shared from Nehemiah 6–7, taking us through the attacks toward Nehemiah as he closed in on the completion of the wall. See Nehemiah's resolve to continue the work God had for him and be inspired to stand firm against the enemies in your life.

See Nehemiah's resolve to continue the work God had for him and be inspired to stand firm against the enemies in your life.

item.title: Rebuilding People
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: After 52 days of great opposition, the walls of Jerusalem were completed. Now, thousands of Israelites gathered together to hear the Word of God for the first time after 70 years of captivity. Here we see one of the first Spirit-filled revivals in history, and we learn that true restoration does not begin until the hearts of men have been revived by the Word of God.

Here we see one of the first Spirit-filled revivals in history, and we learn that true restoration does not begin until the hearts of men have been revived by the Word of God.

item.title: Servanthood That Transcends Age
item.itunes:author: Steve Mayo
item.itunes:summary: In this installment of our study through the Book of 1 Timothy, Pastor Steve Mayo takes an in-depth look at chapter 4 and what it takes to be a devoted servant of Jesus Christ.
item.description: In this installment of our study through the Book of 1 Timothy, Pastor Steve Mayo takes an in-depth look at chapter 4 and what it takes to be a devoted servant of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Repentance that Leads to Revival
item.itunes:summary: After gathering inside the newly rebuilt walls of Jerusalem, the people of Israel began a fast, publicly repenting and confessing their sins and rededicating themselves to worship and obey God. Pastor Fidel Gomez relates this story from Nehemiah 9 and 10 to show that God is forgiving and merciful and that He will bless and revive us when we repent and turn to Him.
item.description: After gathering inside the newly rebuilt walls of Jerusalem, the people of Israel began a fast, publicly repenting and confessing their sins and rededicating themselves to worship and obey God. Pastor Fidel Gomez relates this story from Nehemiah 9 and 10 to show that God is forgiving and merciful and that He will bless and revive us when we repent and turn to Him.

Pastor Fidel Gomez relates this story from Nehemiah 9 and 10 to show that God is forgiving and merciful and that He will bless and revive us when we repent and turn to Him.

item.title: Celebration Day
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In Nehemiah 11 and 12, the Jews in Jerusalem rejoice over the building of the walls with an elaborate, carefully planned celebration. This weekend was FPU Celebration Weekend, and as we heard some amazing testimonies of the work God has done through this class, Pastor Doug shared some important principles regarding the power of celebration.

item.title: Spiritual Leadership
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: What makes someone a strong leader? This weekend, Pastor Doug Sauder closed out our “Build” series through the Book of Nehemiah with a teaching in Nehemiah 13 offering a sober reminder of the qualifications for spiritual leadership.
item.description: What makes someone a strong leader? This weekend, Pastor Doug Sauder closed out our “Build” series through the Book of Nehemiah with a teaching in Nehemiah 13 offering a sober reminder of the qualifications for spiritual leadership.
item.content:encoded: What makes someone a strong leader? This weekend, Pastor Doug Sauder closed out our “Build” series through the Book of Nehemiah with a teaching in Nehemiah 13 offering a sober reminder of the qualifications for spiritual leadership.

item.title: Immovable
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this series-opening teaching on 1 Peter, Lead Pastor Doug Sauder shares how the encouragement to the persecuted early church—shared by a man Jesus referred to as a rock thousands of years ago—is just as applicable to us today as it was then.
item.description: In this series-opening teaching on 1 Peter, Lead Pastor Doug Sauder shares how the encouragement to the persecuted early church—shared by a man Jesus referred to as a rock thousands of years ago—is just as applicable to us today as it was then.

item.title: Don't Just Stand There...
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Continuing in our Immovable message series through the Book of 1 Peter, Pastor Chris Baselice challenges us to live our lives considering the cost of Jesus' blood. We have uncompromising promises through God, but we also have commands . . . to be hopeful, to be holy, to live a God-fearing life, and to fervently love one another. Why? For the glory of God—so people will see God's perfection and works through His people and be drawn to Him despite the trials, pain, and hardship we may face.

item.title: It's Opposite Day in the Kingdom
item.itunes:author: Jeff Denis
item.itunes:summary: As Pastor Jeff Denis picks up our midweek Immovable series, we're reminded that our response to trials is a sacred opportunity to point others to Jesus, and that our suffering looks a whole lot different when viewed through the eternal lens of Scripture.
item.description: As Pastor Jeff Denis picks up our midweek Immovable series, we're reminded that our response to trials is a sacred opportunity to point others to Jesus, and that our suffering looks a whole lot different when viewed through the eternal lens of Scripture.

item.title: Final Words From a Shepherd
item.itunes:author: Joe Ferraro
item.itunes:summary: As Pastor Joe Ferraro wraps up our series in 1 Peter titled, “Immovable,” we learn we are led well by our Shepherd—Jesus—and we should use Him as our model when leading our families and the people we influence.
item.description: As Pastor Joe Ferraro wraps up our series in 1 Peter titled, “Immovable,” we learn we are led well by our Shepherd—Jesus—and we should use Him as our model when leading our families and the people we influence.

item.title: Stretched Beyond The Comfort Zone
item.itunes:summary: We all have our spiritual comfort zones, but Heaven isn't for self-made good or religious people. As Pastor Fidel continues our weekend series in Acts 10, we discover that spiritual power is available to us outside of our traditional comfort zone, because being good is good . . . but it's not good enough.
item.description: We all have our spiritual comfort zones, but Heaven isn't for self-made good or religious people. As Pastor Fidel continues our weekend series in Acts 10, we discover that spiritual power is available to us outside of our traditional comfort zone, because being good is good . . . but it's not good enough.

As Pastor Fidel continues our weekend series in Acts 10, we discover that spiritual power is available to us outside of our traditional comfort zone, because being good is good . . . but it's not good enough.

item.title: Better Together: A Tale Of Two Churches
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: As the church in Jerusalem struggled to accept the reality that Gentiles were being saved and filled with the Holy Spirit, a new church was born in Antioch that would become the staging ground for the expansion of Christianity across the known world. Pastor Doug Sauder explores how God used both churches and people of all backgrounds to accomplish His purpose.
item.description: As the church in Jerusalem struggled to accept the reality that Gentiles were being saved and filled with the Holy Spirit, a new church was born in Antioch that would become the staging ground for the expansion of Christianity across the known world. Pastor Doug Sauder explores how God used both churches and people of all backgrounds to accomplish His purpose.
item.content:encoded: As the church in Jerusalem struggled to accept the reality that Gentiles were being saved and filled with the Holy Spirit, a new church was born in Antioch that would become the staging ground for the expansion of Christianity across the known world. Pastor Doug Sauder explores how God used both churches and people of all backgrounds to accomplish His purpose.

item.title: The Power Of A Praying Church
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In every generation, there have been leaders and philosophers who believe that it's the duty of the human race to extinguish faith in Christ. As Pastor Doug Sauder teaches through the Book of Acts, we learn that when Christians pray together, there's a great unity that occurs that, combined with the power of God, causes the name of Jesus to prevail over every opposition.
item.description: In every generation, there have been leaders and philosophers who believe that it's the duty of the human race to extinguish faith in Christ. As Pastor Doug Sauder teaches through the Book of Acts, we learn that when Christians pray together, there's a great unity that occurs that, combined with the power of God, causes the name of Jesus to prevail over every opposition.

item.title: The Sent Life
item.itunes:author: Billy Venezia Jr.
item.itunes:summary: The word "apostle" means "sent one." Acts 13 tells the story of how Paul was sent out on his first missionary journey along with Barnabas and John Mark. Pastor Billy Venezia explains that all Christians are called and sent out into the world to share the gospel. As we answer that call, we will experience opposition, but also God's favor as we persevere.

item.title: We are at War!
item.itunes:summary: As Christians, we must always be on guard. As Pastor Chet Lowe continues through our series in Acts, we learn we are fighting a war on two fronts: the enemy and our flesh. To be prepared for battle, we must walk in wisdom, light, and love.

item.title: Grace Changes Everything
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: The gospel is a message of grace. Even among believers in the early church it created controversy because of their view of the law. Continuing the series on the Book of Acts, Pastor Doug Sauder explores chapter 15 to expound on the wonderful qualities of grace that reveal God's nature and His plan for us.
item.description: The gospel is a message of grace. Even among believers in the early church it created controversy because of their view of the law. Continuing the series on the Book of Acts, Pastor Doug Sauder explores chapter 15 to expound on the wonderful qualities of grace that reveal God's nature and His plan for us.

Continuing the series on the Book of Acts, Pastor Doug Sauder explores chapter 15 to expound on the wonderful qualities of grace that reveal God's nature and His plan for us.

item.title: Choices
item.itunes:author: Alan Platt
item.itunes:summary: You represent the sum total of the choices of your life. As Pastor Alan Platt continues our series in the Book of Acts, we learn that Scripture invites us to a level of making choices that goes a level beyond right and wrong. This involves wisdom, maturity, and discerning the will of God.
item.description: You represent the sum total of the choices of your life. This involves wisdom, maturity, and discerning the will of God.

As Pastor Alan Platt continues our series in the Book of Acts, we learn that Scripture invites us to a level of making choices that goes a level beyond right and wrong. This involves wisdom, maturity, and discerning the will of God.

item.title: No Time to Waste
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In this study, Pastor Chris Baselice shares from Acts 17 in a timely teaching titled, "No Time to Waste." Here we find Paul on an apostolic mission to persuade both Jew and Gentile the verity of Jesus—the promised Messiah. Today we live in a pluralistic culture, but there is much we can glean from Paul as he delivers a powerful message to an idolatrous people: there is only one way and one truth and that is through Jesus.

item.title: Keeper of the City
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Paul is on a mission to spread the gospel, but he finds himself rejected, beaten, and scorned in every city he sets foot. Now driven to Corinth, a city plagued by sexual immorality, Paul is insufferably grieved and discouraged. Acts 18 teaches us that God loves all people, in all places at all times, and challenges us to consider a simple but sobering question, "Do you feel burdened for the lost in your city?"

item.title: Its Time to Come Clean
item.itunes:summary: Idol worship was running rampant everywhere the Apostle Paul carried the Gospel. As Boca Campus Pastor Jerry Sander teaches through our Bible study series in Acts, we learn the obstacles to the Gospel first century Christians faced were not unlike the obstructions present day believers deal with.

As Boca Campus Pastor Jerry Sander teaches through our Bible study series in Acts, we learn the obstacles to the Gospel first century Christians faced were not unlike the obstructions present day believers deal with.

item.title: The Passionate Preacher
item.itunes:author: Billy Venezia Jr.
item.itunes:summary: In Acts 20, Pastor Billy shows us how faithful friends are a necessity when going through the storms of life. They can help us stay awake spiritually, remind us of God's grace after we fall, and keep our motivation to follow the Lord one of servanthood as opposed to self-seeking. When you serve the Lord continually, in His grace and with the right motivation, you will see that nothing else can do what the Word of God can do.

When you serve the Lord continually, in His grace and with the right motivation, you will see that nothing else can do what the Word of God can do.

item.title: The Will of God
item.itunes:summary: In Acts chapters 21 and 22, we find Paul's faith challenged as he is driven by the Spirit to Jerusalem, despite being cautioned that it may cost his life. However, where God guides He also provides. Here we see God's practical provision as He gives Paul a faithful friend to journey with him, and later, deliverance from the hands of his accusers.
item.description: In Acts chapters 21 and 22, we find Paul's faith challenged as he is driven by the Spirit to Jerusalem, despite being cautioned that it may cost his life. However, where God guides He also provides. Here we see God's practical provision as He gives Paul a faithful friend to journey with him, and later, deliverance from the hands of his accusers.

item.title: Christianity on Trial
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Last week we journeyed with Paul on a collision course to Jerusalem, not knowing if this mission would be his last. This week, we find Paul's faithful obedience to the will of God—confident in knowing that the court of man is in the hands of God.
item.description: Last week we journeyed with Paul on a collision course to Jerusalem, not knowing if this mission would be his last. This week, we find Paul's faithful obedience to the will of God—confident in knowing that the court of man is in the hands of God.

item.title: Against the World, For the World
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: As we look at the last few chapters in the Book of Acts, we see that Christianity has been put on trial. Both the Jewish world and the Roman Empire are trying to figure out why, from city to city, the faith of this growing group of believers is turning the world upside down. Focusing on chapters 25 and 26, Pastor Doug shares a message centered around the gospel, that is as relevant to us today as it was in the first century.
item.description: As we look at the last few chapters in the Book of Acts, we see that Christianity has been put on trial. item.title: Proper Perspective Under the Pressures of Life
item.itunes:summary: In today's study we find Paul's journey rocked by a storm, but despite the foreboding circumstances he is unshaken. When it appears all hope is lost, Paul takes a stand and encourages the men aboard his ship to take heart. Here we find Paul's true character revealed under crisis along with a simple but valuable lesson—it's always too soon to quit.

Here we find Paul's true character revealed under crisis along with a simple but valuable lesson—it's always too soon to quit.

item.title: Is the Revolution Still On?
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Doug wraps up the Book of Acts in chapter 28 by walking us through the final trial of the apostle Paul. Through Paul's journey, we see how his incredible tenacity, to speak God's truth wherever he goes, has been key to spreading the gospel from Ancient Jerusalem all the way to Calvary Chapel Fort Lauderdale. This proves the end of Acts isn't the end of the story and the revolution is still on!

item.title: Celebrating 30 Years of Making Disciples
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In a celebration of thirty years of making disciples since the founding of Calvary Chapel Fort Lauderdale, Pastor Doug Sauder shares scriptures, stories, and insights on how God has used many people to bring thousands to Christ through the ministry happening at this church. Video clips present testimonies from several pastors sent from here to start other churches, and show many people through the years praying to receive Christ.

item.title: The Acts of the Apostles Through Gods Spirit
item.itunes:summary: This weekend, we launched our new teaching series in the Book of Acts as Pastor Chet introduced us to the early days of the Church. We know that as Jesus came to earth to light a fire, His intent was to give us His Spirit, so that we too could spread the fire of the gospel across the world. Christ was crucified, died, and rose again so that we can experience the baptism of His Holy Spirit—the fire from above.
item.description: This weekend, we launched our new teaching series in the Book of Acts as Pastor Chet introduced us to the early days of the Church. We know that as Jesus came to earth to light a fire, His intent was to give us His Spirit, so that we too could spread the fire of the gospel across the world. Christ was crucified, died, and rose again so that we can experience the baptism of His Holy Spirit—the fire from above.

item.title: Baptism of the Holy Spirit
item.itunes:summary: We have a mission to go out into the world and be a witness for Christ—and it's not because we're qualified or perfect for the job. In this message, Pastor Fidel Gomez talks about what it means to receive the baptism of the Holy Spirit. By faith, we ask God to receive it, and He gives us the dynamic ability to do that which we could never imagine doing in our own strength. So, who is in your sphere of influence that can you share the love of God with today?

item.title: Happy Birthday
item.itunes:author: Billy Venezia Jr.
item.itunes:summary: Continuing in our study of the Book of Acts, Pastor Billy Venezia led us through a birthday celebration, as Act 2 tells the story of the birth of the Church. We saw that the coming of the Holy Spirit turned regular “nobodies” into powerful proclaimers of the gospel, and what can happen when the church comes together.
item.description: Continuing in our study of the Book of Acts, Pastor Billy Venezia led us through a birthday celebration, as Act 2 tells the story of the birth of the Church. item.title: The God Who Notices
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: A typical day in the life of the apostles was extraordinary because of the power of the Holy Spirit working through them. Pastor Doug Sauder shares an example of this from Acts chapter 3: Peter and John noticed a blind man, prayed for his healing, and used the resulting miracle to witness to the truth of the gospel, so that thousands were converted.
item.description: A typical day in the life of the apostles was extraordinary because of the power of the Holy Spirit working through them. Pastor Doug Sauder shares an example of this from Acts chapter 3: Peter and John noticed a blind man, prayed for his healing, and used the resulting miracle to witness to the truth of the gospel, so that thousands were converted.

item.title: The Believer's Prayer
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing in our series "Fire From Above," Pastor Doug teaches from Acts 4 where we see the boldness of the apostles in the early stages of Christian persecution, the power of corporate prayer, and how the Holy Spirit teaches us, like He did with Peter, what we could never learn from a book.
item.description: Continuing in our series "Fire From Above," Pastor Doug teaches from Acts 4 where we see the boldness of the apostles in the early stages of Christian persecution, the power of corporate prayer, and how the Holy Spirit teaches us, like He did with Peter, what we could never learn from a book.

item.title: The Message Of The Cross Is Unstoppable
item.itunes:summary: As we continue our "Fire From Above" series in Acts, Pastor Fidel teaches us that life without God is merely existence, but life with Jesus is real life in abundance. We need to share this kind of life with others.
item.description: As we continue our "Fire From Above" series in Acts, Pastor Fidel teaches us that life without God is merely existence, but life with Jesus is real life in abundance. We need to share this kind of life with others.

item.title: The Church Raises Up Leaders
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Continuing the "Fire From Above" series in Acts, Pastor Doug explores how the early Church dealt with issues of justice and unity. He points out how Jesus set the example for reaching out to the forgotten, the scorned, and the disadvantaged. The apostles followed His example by raising up leaders to care for the poor as they preached the gospel.
item.description: Continuing the "Fire From Above" series in Acts, Pastor Doug explores how the early Church dealt with issues of justice and unity. He points out how Jesus set the example for reaching out to the forgotten, the scorned, and the disadvantaged. The apostles followed His example by raising up leaders to care for the poor as they preached the gospel.

item.title: Man On Fire
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: As Pastor Doug Sauder continues this series in Acts, we see Stephen debunk the myths the religious leaders believed about their own faith and how it interacts with history and, most importantly, Israel's Messiah. We also learn that laws, locations, and landmarks are not capable of containing God.
item.description: As Pastor Doug Sauder continues this series in Acts, we see Stephen debunk the myths the religious leaders believed about their own faith and how it interacts with history and, most importantly, Israel's Messiah. We also learn that laws, locations, and landmarks are not capable of containing God.

We also learn that laws, locations, and landmarks are not capable of containing God.

item.title: The Church On Mission
item.itunes:author: Alan Platt
item.itunes:summary: Continuing the series in Acts, guest speaker Alan Platt, pastor of Doxa Deo Church in South Africa, teaches from Acts chapter 8 about the persecution that drove the apostles out of Jerusalem. Eventually they realized that it was God's plan to bring Godly discomfort (through persecution) that would result in a Godly deployment, sending the apostles throughout Judea, Samaria, and beyond to spread the Good News and change the world.
item.description: Continuing the series in Acts, guest speaker Alan Platt, pastor of Doxa Deo Church in South Africa, teaches from Acts chapter 8 about the persecution that drove the apostles out of Jerusalem. Eventually they realized that it was God's plan to bring Godly discomfort (through persecution) that would result in a Godly deployment, sending the apostles throughout Judea, Samaria, and beyond to spread the Good News and change the world.
item.content:encoded: Continuing the series in Acts, guest speaker Alan Platt, pastor of Doxa Deo Church in South Africa, teaches from Acts chapter 8 about the persecution that drove the apostles out of Jerusalem. Eventually they realized that it was God's plan to bring Godly discomfort (through persecution) that would result in a Godly deployment, sending the apostles throughout Judea, Samaria, and beyond to spread the Good News and change the world.

item.title: Man On A Mission
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Saul was passionate about his mission, but until he met Jesus, he was on the wrong mission. As Pastor Doug Sauder continues our study through the Book of Acts in the series "The Fire Spreads," we learn that if you've lost your bearings, Jesus can redirect your misguided mission.
item.description: Saul was passionate about his mission, but until he met Jesus, he was on the wrong mission. As Pastor Doug Sauder continues our study through the Book of Acts in the series "The Fire Spreads," we learn that if you've lost your bearings, Jesus can redirect your misguided mission.

As Pastor Doug Sauder continues our study through the Book of Acts in the series "The Fire Spreads," we learn that if you've lost your bearings, Jesus can redirect your misguided mission.

item.title: Songs That Tutor The Soul
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: The Psalms are best understood as journal entries to God. In this first message of the Psalms series, Pastor Doug Sauder encourages us not to edit our prayers, but to honestly pour out our hearts to Him like the ancient psalmists.
item.description: The Psalms are best understood as journal entries to God. In this first message of the Psalms series, Pastor Doug Sauder encourages us not to edit our prayers, but to honestly pour out our hearts to Him like the ancient psalmists.

item.title: Night and Day
item.itunes:author: Daniel Hickling
item.itunes:summary: Continuing in our Psalms series, Pastor Dan Hickling takes us verse-by-verse through the contrasting themes in Psalms 36 describing the ways in which we overestimate our own goodness and underestimate God's goodness. The first part of the chapter describes the wickedness of man, while the second part paints a picture of God's merciful character.

The first part of the chapter describes the wickedness of man, while the second part paints a picture of God's merciful character.

The first part of the chapter describes the wickedness of man, while the second part paints a picture of God's merciful character.

item.title: God Enough + ? = Enough
item.itunes:author: Reuben Ramsaran
item.itunes:summary: Though God is enough to completely satisfy and complete us, we often look to additional things to fill our lives. Continuing through this series in the Book of Psalms, Pastor Reuben highlights the all-sufficient attributes of God described in Psalms 46 and 51, and challenges us to find our joy and contentment in God alone.
item.description: Though God is enough to completely satisfy and complete us, we often look to additional things to fill our lives. Continuing through this series in the Book of Psalms, Pastor Reuben highlights the all-sufficient attributes of God described in Psalms 46 and 51, and challenges us to find our joy and contentment in God alone.

item.title: Its All About Me
item.itunes:summary: Continuing through this series in the Book of Psalms, Pastor Jerry Sander of our Boca Raton campus teaches from Psalm 86.
item.description: Continuing through this series in the Book of Psalms, Pastor Jerry Sander of our Boca Raton campus teaches from Psalm 86.
item.content:encoded: Continuing through this series in the Book of Psalms, Pastor Jerry Sander of our Boca Raton campus teaches from Psalm 86.

item.title: The Gifts Of God
item.itunes:author: Greg Anderson
item.itunes:summary: God's Word assures us that He is the giver of all good gifts. Pastor Greg Anderson continues our Psalms series by taking us through Psalm 91, where we learn that God is our security, deliverance, courage, perspective, protection, holy help, victory, honor, satisfaction, and salvation.

Pastor Greg Anderson continues our Psalms series by taking us through Psalm 91, where we learn that God is our security, deliverance, courage, perspective, protection, holy help, victory, honor, satisfaction, and salvation.

item.title: The God Who Gathers
item.itunes:author: Billy Venezia Jr.
item.itunes:summary: As Pastor Billy Venezia continues our midweek study in the Book of Psalms, we discover that Psalm 107 is primarily an anthem to God's faithfulness. God is a guide for the weary wanderer, a deliverer for the captive, a physician to the sick, and a safe haven for those who've been tossed by the storms of life.

God is a guide for the weary wanderer, a deliverer for the captive, a physician to the sick, and a safe haven for those who've been tossed by the storms of life.

item.title: Cant We All Just Get Along
item.itunes:author: Reuben Ramsaran
item.itunes:summary: Continuing our Wednesday night series in the Book of Psalms, Pastor Reuben focuses on Psalm 133 as we study the power, sweetness, and essence of unity in the body of Christ.
item.description: Continuing our Wednesday night series in the Book of Psalms, Pastor Reuben focuses on Psalm 133 as we study the power, sweetness, and essence of unity in the body of Christ.

item.title: Obadiah: A Tale of Two Brothers
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Doug Sauder starts us on a 12-week teaching series where we'll study six of the Minor Prophets and discover they each have a major message for us today. This study of Obadiah focuses on the topics of pride, judgement, consequences, and reconciliation.
item.description: Pastor Doug Sauder starts us on a 12-week teaching series where we'll study six of the Minor Prophets and discover they each have a major message for us today. This study of Obadiah focuses on the topics of pride, judgement, consequences, and reconciliation.

item.title: Joel: Making Sense of the Swarm
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: In the Book of Joel, we see that God's people had become so comfortable with the blessings of grain and wine that their hearts had grown cold to the very One who had given them these gifts. As a result, God sent swarms of locusts to devour their crops so they would turn once again to Him. In this message, Pastor Chris Baselice challenges us to see the "swarms" of our own lives as God desires to have our whole-hearted devotion.
item.description: In the Book of Joel, we see that God's people had become so comfortable with the blessings of grain and wine that their hearts had grown cold to the very One who had given them these gifts. As a result, God sent swarms of locusts to devour their crops so they would turn once again to Him. In this message, Pastor Chris Baselice challenges us to see the "swarms" of our own lives as God desires to have our whole-hearted devotion.

In this message, Pastor Chris Baselice challenges us to see the "swarms" of our own lives as God desires to have our whole-hearted devotion.

item.title: Joel: Flash Forward
item.itunes:author: Daniel Hickling
item.itunes:summary: The Book of Joel contains prophecies about events during the time of the author as well as events to occur centuries later. Pastor Dan Hickling focuses on the future events, including the Day of Pentecost recorded in Acts chapter 2, and the Great Tribulation and the Millennium described in Daniel and in Revelation. These prophecies illustrate how God has a plan to protect and prosper His people.

item.title: Bring Revival
item.itunes:summary: The prophet Zephaniah is the focus in this message as we continuing through our series Minor Prophet | Major Message. Pastor Chet Lowe shares how God opposes the proud, gives grace to the humble and it’s time for us to make our choice to purpose to be right with God.
item.description: The prophet Zephaniah is the focus in this message as we continuing through our series Minor Prophet | Major Message. Pastor Chet Lowe shares how God opposes the proud, gives grace to the humble and it’s time for us to make our choice to purpose to be right with God.

item.title: The Character Of God
item.itunes:summary: Though we don't know what God looks like, the Bible paints a clear picture of His character. As we study the prophet Zephaniah's words to God's people, we see that God is relational, faithful, instructional, glorious, and loving. As we learn God's character, our worshipful response brings Him glory.
item.description: Though we don't know what God looks like, the Bible paints a clear picture of His character. As we study the prophet Zephaniah's words to God's people, we see that God is relational, faithful, instructional, glorious, and loving. As we learn God's character, our worshipful response brings Him glory.

As we learn God's character, our worshipful response brings Him glory.

item.title: The Human Complaint
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever asked God, "Why is this happening to me?" Sometimes we look at life and nothing about it makes sense. In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder reminds us no circumstance or trial is too big for God's hands and challenges us to stop asking God "Why?" and start asking "What's next?" God can turn our biggest trial into our biggest testimony for His glory.

God can turn our biggest trial into our biggest testimony for His glory.
