item.title: Hard To Handle
item.itunes:author: Chris Baselice
item.itunes:summary: Continuing the series, Minor Prophets Major Message, Pastor Chris Baselice teaches through chapter two of Habakkuk. This message grapples with God's sovereignty and goodness, and what it means to live by faith when your life seems as though it's in its darkest times.
item.description: Continuing the series, Minor Prophets Major Message, Pastor Chris Baselice teaches through chapter two of Habakkuk. This message grapples with God's sovereignty and goodness, and what it means to live by faith when your life seems as though it's in its darkest times.

item.title: Just Trust
item.itunes:author: Billy Venezia Jr.
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Billy Venezia continues the teaching on the prophet Habakkuk, picking it up in the third chapter. Through this study, we are challenged to look at how important it is to be determined to trust God, even when our circumstances make it difficult to do so.
item.description: Pastor Billy Venezia continues the teaching on the prophet Habakkuk, picking it up in the third chapter. Through this study, we are challenged to look at how important it is to be determined to trust God, even when our circumstances make it difficult to do so.

item.title: Night of Worship
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Between worship sets, Pastor Doug reflects on Habakkuk chapter 3, where the prophet shows us how to revel in God's sovereignty and love in the midst of our unresolved questions and circumstances.
item.description: Between worship sets, Pastor Doug reflects on Habakkuk chapter 3, where the prophet shows us how to revel in God's sovereignty and love in the midst of our unresolved questions and circumstances.

item.title: God At The Center
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Doug Sauder continues the Minor Prophet, Major Message series with the first of a two-part teaching on the prophet Haggai. In this message we are challenged to put God as the center of our lives in a world that is relentless in telling us to put ourselves there.
item.description: Pastor Doug Sauder continues the Minor Prophet, Major Message series with the first of a two-part teaching on the prophet Haggai. In this message we are challenged to put God as the center of our lives in a world that is relentless in telling us to put ourselves there.

item.title: Questioning God
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever questioned God's love for you? Maybe, you never saw a prayer answered or felt like you were treated unjustly. In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder sheds light on God's heart as He responds to the Israelites disappointed and cynical questions.
item.description: Have you ever questioned God's love for you? Maybe, you never saw a prayer answered or felt like you were treated unjustly. In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder sheds light on God's heart as He responds to the Israelites disappointed and cynical questions.

item.title: The Unshakeable Kingdom
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Isn't it amazing that, as believers, we get to stand with God as He advances His unshakeable Kingdom? Teaching from Luke 10, Pastor Doug explores the unequal partnership between God and man. This partnership resembles a parent slowing down when doing a task to allow their child to feel as though they contributed. God does this with us so that we may experience the blessing and reward of coming alongside Him.

Teaching from Luke 10, Pastor Doug explores the unequal partnership between God and man. This partnership resembles a parent slowing down when doing a task to allow their child to feel as though they contributed. God does this with us so that we may experience the blessing and reward of coming alongside Him.

God does this with us so that we may experience the blessing and reward of coming alongside Him.

item.title: The Good Samaritan
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: It's dangerous to your soul to think you can keep the whole law of God. As we look at the story of the Good Samaritan, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches us that it's religious experts that work the hardest to justify themselves. But no amount of human good deeds is equal to the righteousness of God.

As we look at the story of the Good Samaritan, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches us that it's religious experts that work the hardest to justify themselves. But no amount of human good deeds is equal to the righteousness of God.

item.title: Paying Attention
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: With all of the modern day distractions, it's easy to get pulled away and not pay attention to the people we are with, our surroundings, and even God. In this message, Pastor Doug shows us biblical parallels and reminds us how to pay close attention to our families and God.
item.description: With all of the modern day distractions, it's easy to get pulled away and not pay attention to the people we are with, our surroundings, and even God. In this message, Pastor Doug shows us biblical parallels and reminds us how to pay close attention to our families and God.

item.title: Is Your Heart Divided
item.itunes:summary: A divided heart is the heart of a person who loves God, but is also pulled away by the worries, distractions, and temptations of the world. Starting with the parable of the rich fool in Luke chapter 12, Pastor Fidel Gomez shares how Jesus taught that trusting in God completely for everything you need can free you from the worries of a divided heart.
item.description: A divided heart is the heart of a person who loves God, but is also pulled away by the worries, distractions, and temptations of the world. Starting with the parable of the rich fool in Luke chapter 12, Pastor Fidel Gomez shares how Jesus taught that trusting in God completely for everything you need can free you from the worries of a divided heart.
item.content:encoded: A divided heart is the heart of a person who loves God, but is also pulled away by the worries, distractions, and temptations of the world. Starting with the parable of the rich fool in Luke chapter 12, Pastor Fidel Gomez shares how Jesus taught that trusting in God completely for everything you need can free you from the worries of a divided heart.

item.title: End Times Servant
item.itunes:summary: Do you believe we're living in the last days? Drawing from Jesus' words in Luke 12, Pastor Chet Lowe challenges believers to live in a manner that reflects Christ's character—a blessed, loving, strong, strategic, and striving servant—in preparation for His return.
item.description: Do you believe we're living in the last days? Drawing from Jesus' words in Luke 12, Pastor Chet Lowe challenges believers to live in a manner that reflects Christ's character—a blessed, loving, strong, strategic, and striving servant—in preparation for His return.

item.title: Repentance And The Kingdom Of God
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In this message from Luke 13, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches us what repentance looks like. While repentance is an important first act, it is not a one-time act. Instead, repentance is a continual process that produces visible results.
item.description: In this message from Luke 13, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches us what repentance looks like. While repentance is an important first act, it is not a one-time act. Instead, repentance is a continual process that produces visible results.
item.content:encoded: In this message from Luke 13, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches us what repentance looks like. While repentance is an important first act, it is not a one-time act. Instead, repentance is a continual process that produces visible results.

item.title: Tactical Evangelism
item.itunes:summary: Many people think they know God . . . but they don’t know Jesus! Continuing our study through the Book of Luke, Pastor Chet Lowe explores the concept of tactical evangelism, showing believers that in order to reach the lost, we must know our target, outwit the enemy, pray with compassion, and always be ready.
item.description: Many people think they know God . . . but they don’t know Jesus! Continuing our study through the Book of Luke, Pastor Chet Lowe explores the concept of tactical evangelism, showing believers that in order to reach the lost, we must know our target, outwit the enemy, pray with compassion, and always be ready.

item.title: God's Banquet
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: As we dive into the Treasure To Die For series in our Luke Bible study, Pastor Doug shares that Jesus loves a good party! But His invitation list looks differently than ours usually does. While we typically invite people to parties to give our social status a boost, Jesus does the opposite - He invites society's outcasts.

But His invitation list looks differently than ours usually does. While we typically invite people to parties to give our social status a boost, Jesus does the opposite - He invites society's outcasts.

item.title: Looking For The Lost
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever lost something that you really value? Think about the feeling of exhilaration and joy you experience when you finally find your lost item. In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches how God is filled with joy and celebration when one lost sinner is found.
item.description: Have you ever lost something that you really value? Think about the feeling of exhilaration and joy you experience when you finally find your lost item. In this message, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches how God is filled with joy and celebration when one lost sinner is found.

item.title: Serving the Right Master
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In Luke 16, Jesus tackles two controversial topics; money and hell. In this message from Pastor Doug Sauder, we learn that unpopular topics affecting our lives are not edited out of the Bible so we can justify our actions and behavior.
item.description: In Luke 16, Jesus tackles two controversial topics; money and hell. In this message from Pastor Doug Sauder, we learn that unpopular topics affecting our lives are not edited out of the Bible so we can justify our actions and behavior.

item.title: Humility and Gratitude
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: True humility is a difficult thing to come by. Teaching from Luke 17:1-19, Pastor Doug Sauder shows us that humble people can have hard conversations, see their own weaknesses, serve others first, and are grateful to God.
item.description: True humility is a difficult thing to come by. Teaching from Luke 17:1-19, Pastor Doug Sauder shows us that humble people can have hard conversations, see their own weaknesses, serve others first, and are grateful to God.
item.content:encoded: True humility is a difficult thing to come by. Teaching from Luke 17:1-19, Pastor Doug Sauder shows us that humble people can have hard conversations, see their own weaknesses, serve others first, and are grateful to God.

item.title: The Invisible Kingdom
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In Jesus' day, the Pharisees wondered when the kingdom of God would come. In Luke 17:20-37, we learn that God's kingdom is invisible now, but it will one day be revealed in power and glory. Until then, it's our job to allow God to change us from the inside out and live in such a way that we make our King and His kingdom visible to those around us.
item.description: In Jesus' day, the Pharisees wondered when the kingdom of God would come. In Luke 17:20-37, we learn that God's kingdom is invisible now, but it will one day be revealed in power and glory. Until then, it's our job to allow God to change us from the inside out and live in such a way that we make our King and His kingdom visible to those around us.

item.title: The Heart that Connects to God
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Doug Sauder introduces the church's vision for connecting people to God, people to people, and people to outreach. He then teaches from Luke 18, which tells the stories of several people who illustrate the kind of heart we should have toward God: a persistent widow, a humble tax collector, a group of children, and a rich young ruler. If we want to connect with God intimately, we should have a heart that is persistent, humble, childlike, and surrendered.

item.title: Making Disciples
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Christianity is not something you do by yourself. As Pastor Doug Sauder gives the second installment of a three-part message outlining Calvary Chapel's mission and vision, he teaches that becoming a disciple is a lifelong pursuit that requires us to cultivate deep relationships with other disciples.
item.description: Christianity is not something you do by yourself. As Pastor Doug Sauder gives the second installment of a three-part message outlining Calvary Chapel's mission and vision, he teaches that becoming a disciple is a lifelong pursuit that requires us to cultivate deep relationships with other disciples.
item.content:encoded: Christianity is not something you do by yourself. As Pastor Doug Sauder gives the second installment of a three-part message outlining Calvary Chapel's mission and vision, he teaches that becoming a disciple is a lifelong pursuit that requires us to cultivate deep relationships with other disciples.

item.title: New Vision Seeing For The First Time
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Concluding our three-week look into the mission and vision of Calvary Chapel, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches a message on new vision from the Book of Luke. Here, we study the stories of a blind man and a tax collector who encountered Jesus and had their lives changed as we learn that God has given us the ability to see the world through Him, as if for the first time.
item.description: Concluding our three-week look into the mission and vision of Calvary Chapel, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches a message on new vision from the Book of Luke. Here, we study the stories of a blind man and a tax collector who encountered Jesus and had their lives changed as we learn that God has given us the ability to see the world through Him, as if for the first time.
item.content:encoded: Concluding our three-week look into the mission and vision of Calvary Chapel, Pastor Doug Sauder teaches a message on new vision from the Book of Luke. Here, we study the stories of a blind man and a tax collector who encountered Jesus and had their lives changed as we learn that God has given us the ability to see the world through Him, as if for the first time.

item.title: All In: A Disciples Passion
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Passion is an intense feeling or conviction that God gives us for a reason. A disciple will channel his passion, not into fulfilling his own desires, but into things of eternal value that matter to God: stewardship, obedience, and worship. Like Jesus, a disciple will also be passionate about reaching the lost and honoring the church as a place of prayer.
item.description: Passion is an intense feeling or conviction that God gives us for a reason. A disciple will channel his passion, not into fulfilling his own desires, but into things of eternal value that matter to God: stewardship, obedience, and worship. Like Jesus, a disciple will also be passionate about reaching the lost and honoring the church as a place of prayer.

A disciple will channel his passion, not into fulfilling his own desires, but into things of eternal value that matter to God: stewardship, obedience, and worship. Like Jesus, a disciple will also be passionate about reaching the lost and honoring the church as a place of prayer.

item.title: The Authority of God
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Who do you think you are? That's the tone that was set for Jesus by religious leaders during His final week of ministry. Continuing through the Book of Luke, Pastor Doug Sauder examines the most severe public challenges to Jesus' authority ever recorded. Jesus turned these harsh confrontations into incredible teaching opportunities.
item.description: Who do you think you are? That's the tone that was set for Jesus by religious leaders during His final week of ministry. Continuing through the Book of Luke, Pastor Doug Sauder examines the most severe public challenges to Jesus' authority ever recorded. Jesus turned these harsh confrontations into incredible teaching opportunities.

Continuing through the Book of Luke, Pastor Doug Sauder examines the most severe public challenges to Jesus' authority ever recorded. Jesus turned these harsh confrontations into incredible teaching opportunities.

item.title: A Glimpse into the Future
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Luke chapter 21 reveals important things Jesus had to say about the future during the last week of His life on earth. He predicted the destruction of the temple in Jerusalem and the events leading up to His Second Coming. Pastor Doug Sauder reminds us that the most important thing for us to know about the future is that we can and should be ready for it.
item.description: Luke chapter 21 reveals important things Jesus had to say about the future during the last week of His life on earth. He predicted the destruction of the temple in Jerusalem and the events leading up to His Second Coming. Pastor Doug Sauder reminds us that the most important thing for us to know about the future is that we can and should be ready for it.

item.title: The Communion Table
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Everybody is accepted. As Pastor Doug Sauder teaches about the last Thursday of Jesus' earthly ministry, we learn about the access Jesus has given us to the communion table. It's a safe place to fail, to be restored, and to fellowship. Jesus wants us to remember Him at the communion table.
item.description: Everybody is accepted. As Pastor Doug Sauder teaches about the last Thursday of Jesus' earthly ministry, we learn about the access Jesus has given us to the communion table. It's a safe place to fail, to be restored, and to fellowship. Jesus wants us to remember Him at the communion table.

It's a safe place to fail, to be restored, and to fellowship. Jesus wants us to remember Him at the communion table.

item.title: Drawing Closer To The Cross
item.itunes:summary: The final week of Jesus' ministry is building toward its great climax. As Pastor Fidel Gomez continues this series through the Book of Luke, we're reminded of God's unconditional love as it's shown by the multiple sacrifices that Jesus made for us out of a pure heart.
item.description: The final week of Jesus' ministry is building toward its great climax. As Pastor Fidel Gomez continues this series through the Book of Luke, we're reminded of God's unconditional love as it's shown by the multiple sacrifices that Jesus made for us out of a pure heart.

item.title: Jesus On Trial
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Jesus endured numerous trials in the hours before His crucifixion. He was sinless and without fault, but His accusers condemned Him because they refused to see their own sin. In a study of Luke chapters 22 and 23, Pastor Doug Sauder points out that our opinion of Jesus is not really a judgment of Him, but of ourselves.
item.description: Jesus endured numerous trials in the hours before His crucifixion. He was sinless and without fault, but His accusers condemned Him because they refused to see their own sin. In a study of Luke chapters 22 and 23, Pastor Doug Sauder points out that our opinion of Jesus is not really a judgment of Him, but of ourselves.
item.content:encoded: Jesus endured numerous trials in the hours before His crucifixion. He was sinless and without fault, but His accusers condemned Him because they refused to see their own sin. In a study of Luke chapters 22 and 23, Pastor Doug Sauder points out that our opinion of Jesus is not really a judgment of Him, but of ourselves.

item.title: The King On A Cross
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Luke 23 tells the story of a King in disguise - convicted and condemned by those who didn't recognize His true identity. Continuing in Luke, Pastor Doug Sauder discusses four men who saw the King for who He really was - Simon of Cyrene, the thief at the cross, a centurion, and Joseph of Arimathea.
item.description: Luke 23 tells the story of a King in disguise - convicted and condemned by those who didn't recognize His true identity. Continuing in Luke, Pastor Doug Sauder discusses four men who saw the King for who He really was - Simon of Cyrene, the thief at the cross, a centurion, and Joseph of Arimathea.

item.title: We Are Witnesses
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever been afraid to be a witness to someone? As Pastor Doug Sauder takes us through the final chapter of Luke, we learn how Jesus appeared before His followers after His resurrection and asked them to be a witness of the things they had seen when they walked with Him. We too are called to be His witness. To do so, you don't have to be a Bible scholar. All you need to do is share your testimony of all that God has done for you in your life.

item.title: The Habit of Service
item.itunes:subtitle: Philippians 2:1–11
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Watch as Pastor Doug closes out “The Good Life” series with a powerful look at the habit of service. In this message, we discover that when we serve others, we’re participating in the divine. We also learn that Christian service is more than just action, it’s also about posture and attitude, and it requires practice.

item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Doug kicks off our special holiday series titled “Peace” with a message from Isaiah 1, 7, and 9. In this first message, we discover what peace truly is and why the peace we all seek and long for can only be found in Jesus.

item.itunes:subtitle: Isaiah 53:5, John 16:33
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week two of our Christmas series, Pastor Doug Sauder shares how we can exchange anxiety for peace, what true peace looks like, where it actually comes from, and how we can join Jesus in the fight for it!

item.title: Jesus Unites Us
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week one of "Undivided," Pastor Doug Sauder shares how Jesus brings unity between us and what we can do to maintain unity in a world that seeks to divide us.
item.description: In week one of "Undivided," Pastor Doug Sauder shares how Jesus brings unity between us and what we can do to maintain unity in a world that seeks to divide us.

item.title: Jesus Unites Us on a Mission
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In part two of "Undivided," Pastor Doug Sauder shares how Jesus unites us as a community for a purpose and mission! Learn all about this great purpose, what can happen the Church is united, and how we can live on mission right where God has placed us.

item.title: Jesus Unites Us as a Demonstration
item.itunes:author: Ed Stetzer
item.itunes:summary: Concluding our "Undivided" series, special guest Dr. Ed Stetzer of Lifeway and Wheaton Bible College joins us as we discover how unity in the church demonstrates the love of Jesus to those who don't know Him. We also examine the message of reconciliation and how we’re called to live it out and share it with others.

item.title: Embracing Racial Oneness
item.itunes:author: Tony Evans
item.itunes:summary: This special sanctuary class series featuring teachings from Dr. Tony Evans explores biblical unity and race. In this first session, Dr. Tony shares a powerful perspective on race and how we can embrace the idea of oneness as a people.

item.itunes:author: Tony Evans
item.itunes:summary: In week two of our class series on racial reconciliation with Dr. Tony Evans, we hear about John 4 and the woman at the well in order to learn how the kingdom of God and not any earthly label is what defines us!

item.title: The Key to Kingdom Oneness and Holding Back Evil through the Church
item.itunes:author: Dr. Tony Evans
item.itunes:summary: Concluding our conversation around racism and reconciliation with the sixth installment of Dr. Tony Evans’ Oneness Embraced series, this message explores the overall key to accomplishing oneness as the body of Christ.
item.description: Concluding our conversation around racism and reconciliation with the sixth installment of Dr. Tony Evans’ Oneness Embraced series, this message explores the overall key to accomplishing oneness as the body of Christ.
item.content:encoded: Concluding our conversation around racism and reconciliation with the sixth installment of Dr. Tony Evans’ Oneness Embraced series, this message explores the overall key to accomplishing oneness as the body of Christ.

item.title: Generous Like Jesus
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: Kicking off our special three-week vision series, Pastor Doug will share about the generosity of God, how it changes our lives, and how it fuels our generosity.
item.description: Kicking off our special three-week vision series, Pastor Doug will share about the generosity of God, how it changes our lives, and how it fuels our generosity.
item.content:encoded: Kicking off our special three-week vision series, Pastor Doug will share about the generosity of God, how it changes our lives, and how it fuels our generosity.

item.title: Generosity's Joy
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In week two of this special vision series, we explore what whole-life generosity is all about and what it looks like practically to be generous like Jesus.
item.description: In week two of this special vision series, we explore what whole-life generosity is all about and what it looks like practically to be generous like Jesus.
item.content:encoded: In week two of this special vision series, we explore what whole-life generosity is all about and what it looks like practically to be generous like Jesus.

item.title: Generosity’s Light
item.itunes:subtitle: Matthew 5:14-16; Isaiah 60:1-3
item.itunes:author: Doug Sauder
item.itunes:summary: In the conclusion to our vision series, we hear from Pastor Doug about the impact generosity can have. Explore how generosity can spark a movement of the gospel, how it changes people’s lives, and how God can extend the reach of our generosity far beyond what we’ll ever see.
